description:
The place is small and cozy. They do not sell liquor, it's BYOB, but will provide wine glasses and will open and serve.  (If you forget the wine, can be procured right next door).  

Food was great, servings generous. Had the Classic Lasagna, Penne All'Arrabbiata, Gnocchi alla Sorrentina, and of course dessert. 

We will return
author: Teresa F.

description:
I tried this restaurant for the first time today on my lunch break. It was a truly wonderful experience!

The restaurant is very clean, nicely decorated, and it smells like heaven. 

The gentleman who greeted me and took my order was incredibly friendly and helpful. He seems like a lovely person. 

I ordered the Funghi and Salsiccia to go. The pizza came out fast, but it was very fresh and delicious. In fact, I ate most of it before I even thought to take a picture. 

I will definitely stop by again!
author: Olivia O.

description:
Overall, very average food and very average experience. They charged us for more drinks than we had, but the service was so slow that it wasn't even worth complaining about.

Wouldn't go back.
author: Alli N.

description:
My favorite Italian Restaurant in north Beach. They make pizza just like my mom made. Everything is super fresh and homemade. And great value especially for San Francisco. Never disappointed. 
This is the real deal on many levels. Buona apetito!
author: Salvatore R.

description:
I really liked this place! The smells going in were very fine and definitely a welcome scene from the windy cold outside. The place was packed but we got seated pretty quickly. The place looked very busy and everyone seemed to be having a good time. The owner? Greeted us warmly and led us to our table. 
I ordered the lasagna classico and we got a margarita pizza to share. The lasagna was amazing! Very authentic tasting with an amazing flavor. I really enjoyed the stretchy cheese and meaty sauce. The pizza was also excellent with aromatic basil flavors and great mozzarella. 
My friends got the tortellini and gnocchi respectively and they both looked very good. I'd definitely come again and really recommend this place.
author: Lawrence H.

description: Nice quaint little spot with great pasta and pizza.  Had a delicious plate of meatballs, a tasty burrata and my wife had a crab ravioli that was delicious while my some had a penne dish with pink sauce.  Very reasonable too - our whole dinner was around $50.
author: Basem T.

description: Amazingly good food, great atmosphere, owner and staff are awesome.  Highly recommend!
author: Stephen H.

description:
We were around the pier craving Italian food and found Piccolo Forno on Yelp! 

They have tables outside as well as insides. The interior is pretty nice.

We had the Alfredo pasta which I think was the best dish out of all 3 we ordered. The carbonara was pretty good and the pizza I forgot the name but it had this unique taste that I personally didn't like it was like wine infused tomato sauce or something but the mozzarella tasted fresh. 

Customer service was great our server refilled our water when needed and asked us how we liked our meal. 

Overall, this place place was pretty good I'll probably come back to try more pizza!
author: An L.

description:
Reasons why you should come here: 
-very nice Italian owner with friendly staff 
-clean and modern but reminded me of those small but amazing restaurants in Rome 
-open kitchen because they have nothing to hide! 
-authentic food 

I came here on a Wednesday evening with a friend and the restaurant was about 75% full. Glad we got seated right away because we were so hungry after an long day of work! We ordered the burrata, Ideale pizza, and spaghetti with meatballs. Burrata was amazing.. as it should be since it is such a simple antipasto. The Ideale pizza was made with good quality ingredients and it wasn't greasy. (I ate the leftovers the next day for lunch and it was almost even better!) The spaghetti with meatballs was me and my friend's favorite. It had thick tomato sauce and super flavorful meatballs. The pasta was cooked perfectly! It's like they used a timer and a thermometer to make sure it was cooked right. We ordered simple dishes and everything was made to perfection. 

I think the perks of having a small restaurant is that the owner has the opportunity to be present at the restaurant and interact with his customers. I did not catch the owners name but as I've mentioned before.. he was so nice and friendly! Other yelpers have already mentioned this and I must agree. He gave us complimentary beverage and dessert, which I really appreciate. Maybe he sensed that we had a tough day at work, and we needed something to mend our mid-week crisis LOL. My 5-star rating isn't because he gave us complimentary items, but it is because of the food, staff, and atmosphere. 

Thanks Piccolo Forno owner! Can't wait to come back and try the other dishes.
author: Joyce S.

description:
Amazing local Italian restaurant. We got the crab ravioli and the lasagna both of which were excellent. Perfectly cooked pasta and a lot of meat in the lasagna. 

There was enough seating that we were able to quickly get a table with a lot of space. The waiter was very nice and kept the water constantly filled.
author: Eric W.

description: The workers were super nice and outgoing and the food was amazing I'll definitely be back to eat there when I visit San Francisco again
author: Domineka B.

description: We found a cockroach in the olive oil used for dipping the bread into. Both the carbonara and the Alfredo were very bland. Giving them one star for the pizza that we ordered. The only decent thing that we had all night. Will most definitely not be back.
author: Andrea M.

description:
The food here is amazing.   

If you have a group with some who want pizza and some who want pasta or other dishes, this intimate, but friendly Italian eatery will surprise and charm you with their good, flavorful food and quick service.  

In this neighborhood, there's a lot of competition for your dining dollar.  I submit to you this small, independent dining establishment.   If you want some pizza to go, there're several ready-made by-the-slice pizzas to choose from.   If you want to bring a bottle of vino and ask them to serve it with your food, they will gladly oblige.  

Some of our group wanted individual marguerita pizzas, a shared platter of grilled vegetable sides (delicious and recommended), and some wanted lasagna or crab ravioli.    We were all pretty hungry.  Soon after poring over the menu and placing our order, a couple of dishes of bread were brought out and olive oil to dip it in.  Water glasses and carafes of water were brought out, too.   

The kitchen was fairly open, so if you wanted to watch the chefs prepare your food, you could.  Or, you can enjoy some conversation  in a convivial atmosphere that is Piccolo Forno.

The   food was all very, very good. The crab raviolis were served with a pink,creamy sauce.   Cutting each in half to make bite-sized, you could see the stuffing of fresh crab meat plumping each little pillow.

The lasagna...my gosh, the lasagna... delicious and resounding with umame.   

From watching my friends polish off their pizzas,it was obvious that they were enjoying their food, as well.

Dessert: we got one lemon sorbet served in a whole lemon skin for a friend's daughter.   Watching her enjoy the treat was fun.  then the plates of tiramisu the rest of us were sharing arrived, and we got caught up in the enjoyment of our own plates.


I will look forward to returning to this place in the future.  The food is just great, and the pricing is very reasonable.   Mangia Mangia!
author: Candace Y.

description: This  delightful restaurant is popular with locals and tourist alike. The food is fantastic, prepared with attention and passion. The service is attentive and professional, but also warm and friendly. Don't be scared off by their lack of alcohol; BYOB and consider it a discount (they will gladly provide wine glasses and open and pour your bottle.) Located on Columbus it has a convenient, yet quiet location. How Michael Bauer (SF Chron food critic) missed this place in his 'favorite North Beach restaurants' article is a mystery to all of us who cherish this neighborhood gem.
author: J E.

description: Lasagna was delicious and the owner was very  very cute restaurant. Also have gluten free options
author: Lorain C.

description: Ownership of this establishment rocks. From the first time I walked into this pizzaria resturante I was treated like an elite customer. Pizza is served in the North Beach style in a 6 inch square slice. If you are in North Beach for lunch you won't have to wait normally like some of the other pizza joints. The owner is friendly and takes care of each client as they walk in the door.
author: Derald C.

description:
Excellent.  Like being in Italy.  Modern but comfortable ambiance.  Friendly fun staff.  Great food.  In our party:
Local halibut puttanesca - generous portion, spot on flavors; served on a healthy bed of grilled vegetables.  (European style: mind the bones and olive pits)
Homemade ravioli - also spot-on
Pizza - Romana style, perfectly crisp and drizzled with EVOO
Alfredo - also perfectly done.  

Desserts are definitely worth checking out, especially the panna cota and lemon sorbetto. 

Great meal--we'll be back.  

Oh! P.s.: no liquor license, but you're welcome to BYOB or purchase next door.  No corkage and they have the glasses.   

And...continuing on the authentic streak: they don't hurry you out when done eating.  Stay, talk. Bene!
author: Steve K.

description: A nice cozy casual place with BYOW scenes. Ordered Linguini with pink sauce ...pretty nice for a first time. Would like to try their raviolis next time. Ohh ...they have some amazing coffees to finish off your meal.
author: Prateek R.

description: Average and sloppy. Service non existent. Greek salad wasn't Greek, had no olives or proper dressing instead it had some Italian vinegarette.
author: John W.

description:
Stopped in for a quick bite before going to a wine tasting based in the reviews other people left. Great looking, clean, modern as described.  The waiter was about as friendly and authentically Italian as you could ask for.  He was prompt, courteous, and efficient plus the accent made me feel like I was in Italy.

Ordered the fusili puttanesca (my favorite sauce).  Water and really good bread was delivered almost immediately with the food out 5 minutes later.  Overall decent puttanesca. And well cooked pasta.  For the price I'd say it's a good deal, but it's not what I'd call amazing.

The Good: very clean place with extremely nice staff.  Prompt, efficient, etc.  He was being genuinely kind to everyone I saw come in while I was there.  Nice menu.  Great prices.  Great value.

The Bad: nothing at all! 

The Mediocre: the puttanesca sauce itself was just ok.  Now before I get flamed, I didn't say it was bad.  It was fine for a basic tomato sauce with some capers and olives added. And a couple pieces of fresh basil. And it was delivered quickly.  It just wasn't the long stewed amazing, aromatic work of art that oozes garlic and oomami.  I was a little disappointed, that's all.  Everything else (including the price) more than made up for it.  

Overall: great and friendly place for a quick bite of good tasting pasta.  Good value and nice folks.  I'll stop in again for sure.
author: John G.

description: This place is wonderful! From the incredibly friendly owner to the sweet ambiance this place is a winner! We had the days special ravioli and the gnocchi (do not miss these little pillows of heaven!) truly an amazing little restaurant. Very very pleased we stopped in and can't wait to come again!
author: Allegra M.

description: Overall food was good, service was excellent. I had the Penne Piccolo Forno, an eggplant, mozzarella, and basil pasta dish. All the flavors and textures complimented each other well. We were also served complimentary bread with olive oil and red pepper flakes in olive oil as well as a panna cotta desert. The only drawback was waiting an hour outside to be seated. But it was a Saturday evening so I can't complain too much.
author: Julia S.

description: I came here recently and had an amazing experience. The staff was amazing and the biggest plus was that there was no corkage fee. I cant wait to come back and give some other dishes a try. Food was good, I believe once I try some different dishes that I can change this review to a solid 5 stars.
author: MJ L.

description: Had such a good experience here! Had our mind set on another place across the street, but it was too busy and we wanted to sit down for dinner after a long day touristing our neighbor town San Francisco. We looked in, got approached from behind by a guy asking if we were three. "Get that table in the corner!" "We don't serve alcohol, but you can get a nice bottle of wine next door!" Said and done. Got a nice Primitivo next door. Shared a lovely Caprese for entree, and then Pasta Carbonara, Alfredo and a Tortelloni al Fungi as main courses. Everything tasted great and the service was friendly and swift. We finished up with a Pannacotta with strawberries. All lovely, we will be back!
author: Maria A.

description: Delicious place definitely worth the wait! The pasta was cooked perfectly to al dents with just the right amount of bite and the sauce was a wonderful mingling of basil, oil, tomato's, mozzarella, and eggplant. I would recommend waiting for this place because you won't be disappointed!
author: Smrithi M.

description: The best Italian food I've had, dare I say, ever!! We order the lasagna, gnocchi and fettuccine, plus a pizza to share. Literally, they do EVERYTHING right. Of course we had a favorite- the gnocchi. Also stuff was super kind!
author: Nikki W.

description:
Sorry.   Nice ambience but at best mediocre
food.  Salads good.  Pasta w clams oily
and heavy with unpleasant burnt flavor.
The touted lasagne was bland with a sauce 
subpar to a market jar sauce.  Take some homemade Italian cooking lessons Piccolino.
author: andrew b.

description: My first time here and I would definitely go back. Had the arugula salad, which was yummy! The cheese was salty the arugula was dressed perfectly and very fresh. The crab ravioli was delicious, but the shining star was the Gnocchi!!! It was amazing!! Melted in your mouth, the combination of sauce to cheese to basil was delicate, decadent and perfectly balanced. The prices are super affordable too!
author: Michelle F.

description: Charming place with two Italian gentlemen manning the front.  Service was prompt (the two seemed to be working interchangeably), but our salad was forgotten with our entrees (which took a fair bit of time to get).  We had pastas and the highest marks went to the gnocchi while the carbonara was just meh.  Ravioli was fine.  The waiter (#2) came and recited our order before bringing the bill--including our forgotten salad--to which we reminded him we never got it.  ("Oh, of course.")  It wasn't on the bill, but our lunch's pacing was kinda weird--something was off-kilter.  Packed with lunchtime crowd.
author: Monty H.

description: Fabulous find in North Beach! Tiny little spot with amazing flavors. The bread is like no other I've tried in the city - melt in your mouth good! The Greca salad had the most vibrant dressing on it, super refreshing for a hot day. We ordered 2, 12" inch pizzas, both were fabulous. Definitely worth driving into the city for - we will be back!
author: Candida B.

description:
Found this place wandering around and stopped in for lunch. Staff was extremely friendly. Large delicious pizza for $4.00/ square. The halibut melted in your mouth and was extremely healthy. The egg plant was fantastic.Fresh homemade ravioli was extremely rich And delicious

Highly recommend .
author: Rob D.

description: Excellent service, agreeable prices, delicious meals.  Giuseppe has created a very good place that people keep coming back to.  It's the REAL Italian pizza, pasta, insalate you've been looking for in SF.
author: Michael G.

description: Everyone that has come in as been personally acknowledged by who I think is the owner. They shake hands, smile, maybe even a hug. Super friendly. They are so popular there's a line our the door on a Friday night, but you won't wait longer than 30 min. Sadly, they are also so popular that they ran out of lasagna. I left the group I was with to grab some lasagna from somewhere else. Piccolo was nice enough to let me join my group due to the inconvenience, and they still waited on me even though I had a meal from somewhere else. Highly recommend. Average price of food is around $15.
author: Cutter P.

description:
This place was very good! Our friends stopped by to get pizza and the very next day, we were trying to figure out what to eat near Pier 39 area and decided to walk over to here (which is farther from there than expected but it was fine). 

They give you bread when you sit down which is nice--load up on those carbs! We each ordered a pizza for ourselves and a couple people took some other stuff like the burratta appetizer (so bomb) and amongst our table, people got the Prociutto Crudo, Vegetariana, Tonno & Cipolla, Lasanga, 4 Frommaggi, and a bunch of the antipasti.. I took the Cappriciosa which was good! But I gave the egg away to someone accidentally :( The artichokes were a little overpowering but overall the dish was really good--flavorful, fresh, and great cheese! I was a fan!

Would come back and probably get the gnocchi and some of the other pizzas my table got, all of which looked tasty! Highly recommend if you're in the area
author: Nerissa C.

description: Some of the best pasta we have had in a while! Love the seats facing the street to people watch, just like in Europe. The smells are amazing and the waiters were all so kind and happy. The dress is very casual and the noise level is medium. We will most definitely be coming back here to enjoy their food. Thank you Piccolo Forno!
author: Breanne B.

description: Good food. Very stingy with Parmesan cheese. I like it at the table. Drinks are not desirable. My husband had a Snapple tea that had 46 grams of sugar after ordering a regular iced tea. Sorry for his pre diabetes
author: Chrissy C.

description: I love this place.  Their caesar salad is good and it's different compare to the other place.  The lobster ravioli is delicious. Lobster is fresh and the ravioli sauce is so so good.  The services are good and all servers are super nice.
author: Quynh N.

description: Amazing food and great service. If you are in San Francisco area you must try this wonderful little restaurant. The food is delicious and yes it may take a few minutes to be seated since so many people want to eat here but I must say it is worth the wait.
author: Jay R.

description:
Great for a quick, casual bite.  Food was tasty and service was friendly in a warm and clean environment.

Piccolo Forno means "little oven".  In the open kitchen, you could see that this small kitchen churned out mighty good food.  We ordered the crab ravioli and the spaghetti and meatballs.  Both came in substantial portions (we were too full for dessert afterwards) but the food was a SOLID 5/5.  

Crab ravioli came with a creamy sauce, and spaghetti arrived to the table piping hot and noodles perfectly al dente.  Absolutely delicious!  Our Caesar salad had crunchy lettuce leaves perfectly coated with dressing and topped with anchovies and capers.

We were surprised by how affordable our meal was.
The bill for 2 full plates of pasta and a large salad was under $40.  Amazing in today's SF living standards.  Just wish they offered more creative drinks than run of the mill soda, so we stuck to water.  I don't recall seeing the wine list.

Our service was friendly and everyone was speaking in Italian.  It didn't feel like the usual tourist trap in North Beach.  More like a neighborhood casual bite.  Which honestly was a little confusing.  The service felt attentive enough that it should have been more upscale, but everything else reflected a casual atmosphere.  This place is best suited for families or a group of friends.  Not a romantic place for couples or a fancy night out.

So did Piccolo Forno blow us away?  No.  
Was the food delicious and well prepared?  Yes.  
Authentic?  Yes.  
Service friendly?  Yes.  

Will we be back?
YES!
author: Cin P.

description: This place is great! Fresh home made Italian food! We stumbled across this place accidentally. Walked by the front door was wide open and you could smell the delicious food. They weren't open yet but Massimo let us sit a few min early. He was also our server and he was awesome! He is polite and attentive. The food is delicious! I had tortellini in 3 formaggio, my friends had gnocchi and pizza margarita. Classic Italian dishes. We all shared and all dishes were awesome. This place clearly has an excellent chef behind the menu. I'm assuming since they nailed 3 for 3 on our dishes that everything on the menu is amazing. Can't wait to come back here to try more. If you are in the neighborhood this place is totally worth it and it is not expensive at all. Great food great service great prices great smells and a clean restroom, what more can you ask for! Check this place out
author: David M.

description:
This place came highly recommended by our AirBnB hosts, who knew we were traveling with 2 elementary school -aged kids.

BYOD, no cork fees!!! (Liquor store 2 blocks away).

Amazing Italian food made by real Italians :))). Ordered a large pasta and meatballs entree for the kids to split. It came with meat ragout sauce and meatballs. Kids polished it off in seconds and fought for leftovers.

We had a few appetizers and a pizza, ate everything to the last crumb! 

Will be back for sure
author: Katherine G.

description:
My second time here and I can't say enough about the food as well as the owner Guiseppe! Super nice guy with a big heart who offers personalized, awesome service! The food is beyond delicious! Real Italian food is hard to find. The part I like most is that he offers quick bites to go right on the spot at the front counter or you can hang for a couple hours and enjoy a 5 course meal if you feel inclined.

Thank you Guiseppe!
author: Sandy J.

description:
Best Italian restaurant I've been to outside of Italy! The food was beyond excellent. The service was super friendly, very considerate, and just all around pleasant. 

1. Burrata (5/5): Very creamy, yet light. Came on a bed of arugula and delicious prosciutto.

2. Spaghetti and meatballs (5/5): Excellent. Love it when a restaurant does a wonderful job on an old classic. The meatballs were tender, flavorful, and plentiful. No joke, they don't skimp on the meatballs. The ragu sauce was hearty, and the pasta was cooked to a perfect al dente.

3. Tuna Pasta (5/5): This was a special, recommended by our server. Spaghetti with fresh tuna, pancetta, mushrooms, all tossed in parmesan and olive oil. Light and very flavorful. Again, pasta was cooked to a perfect al dente. 

4. Complimentary bread + olive oil (5/5): The bread was fresh out of the oven (really, we watched them pull it out)! Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. The olive oil was nice and fruity.

5. Cappuccino (5/5) 

The pizzas also looked amazing, but we were too full to order one. Next time!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Fantastic experience all around!
$4 for slices of pizza. 
Halibut special was delicious and healthy. Portobello ravioli was divine. 
We found this place wandering around and looking for lunch. We were greeted promptly and seated. Service was quick and friendly.
author: S M.

description:
Mamma Mia! Such a great local establishment in the beautiful North Beach. :)

It's genuine Italian, and though they don't serve alcohol, it's BYOB without a corkage fee. :) Many non-sketchy corner stores around this adorable area to pick up a last-minute bottle of wine.

We ordered the gnocchi and a pizza- both delicious. I've had their assorted veggies of the day in previous trips here, and they are even better than the menu dishes.

The staff are so friendly and food is so good and well-priced- can't beat it. Deserves its great rating. :)
author: Katherine G.

description:
One of my favorite places to go in North Beach sort of at the end of neighborhood. No beer/wine but little known secret: bring your own and there's no corkage--even better! You can pick up a bottle at the convenient store across from Cobbs. Prices for dishes are reasonable, casual environment, wait staff is nice, will sometimes have the game on, which is a plus. Quiet calm environment, which I prefer.

Italian Homemade has great pasta, and Piccolo Forno's are of similar quality, but I would claim that Piccolo Forno has slightly better sauces. I'm not Italian, so I can't vouch for authenticity, but there is something about them that just happily remind me of my childhood. Again--never grew up Italian and I'm not an expert, but I have been to Ideale (also I highly recommend), Sotto Mare (a different thing since it's seafood), Caffe Sport, and a few others along and off the main drag, and I would get a red and/or meat sauce any day from Piccolo Forno. Haven't been enough times to try the pizza, but one of these days...
author: Sleepy B.

description: Great mea (again). This time the mushroom ravioli were exceptional. Delicious fresh para stuffed with mushrooms with a hint of truffle in the ravioli and in the sauce. Perfect.
author: Corinne A.

description: Great food with a friendly, neighborhood atmosphere.  My favorites are the Margherita pizza and Cesare salad.  Eat in, or if you're local and prefer to eat at home, you can order for pickup.  Yum!
author: Rosie M.

description:
When I return to San Francisco, this will be a mandatory stop.

Perfectly light cream sauce, savory and smooth vodka sauce... And perfectly cooked pasta. My student center I began with a salad of arugula and pecorino tossed with a ball sonic vinaigrette. After our perfectly prepared past her hives, we were all in heaven. And my personal favorite dessert, Pana cotta was just barely sweet enough to be considered a dessert. It was a perfect evening. 

If I could give this family restaurant six stars for kindness, speed, accuracy, and deliciousness, I would!
author: Jacob H.

description: My daughters and I really enjoyed our meal here. We start d with the Cesar which was top notch. We then had the crab ravioli, Alfredo and cheese ravioli with pesto. All were excellent. The only downsides were the lack of wine (I am the only drinker and would have enjoyed a glass) and it was crowded - which is really a good thing in the long run. The staff was excellent too.
author: Sarah C.

description: a friend picked this cute little spot for girls night yesterday and we all loved it!  it's been on my list for a while, and it's great that it's BYOB because it really keeps dinner costs low!  the owner is very italian and so sweet. we ordered the carbonara, a pizza with egg and prosciutto, and the crab ravioli.  the carbonara wasnt as creamy and delicious as we were hoping for, but the other two dishes more than made up for it.  i would come back for the pizza a hundred times over! so yum, and does not taste super guilty :) we also shared the panna cotta with strawberry and the tiramisu - great!
author: Christina L.

description: Delicious food! The Gnocchi was unbelievable , the Beretta was unbelievably fresh as well. Highly recommend, genuinely delicious authentic Italian food
author: Lauren O.

description: Fantastic pasta and beautiful owner/waiter Guisseppe. Eaten twice with family in 2 weeks, love the the Gnocchi. best in town
author: Paul E.

description: Best. Sauce. Ever. Don't even waste your time going anywhere else in North Beach for traditional Italian - this place is the BEST, and we have been close to everywhere before discovering Giuseppe and co at Piccolo Forno. The pasta is perfection - the bucatini dish is amazing - and so is the penne with eggplant. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They've got a woman on the pizza oven and Italian men on the floor. Also - this gem is BYOB. I love this place, and so will you.
author: Richie B.

description: You feel like your stepping into Italy as you step into Piccolo Forno. This place is really adorable, with a very friendly and hospitable owner. The pizza here is wow!...light crunchy but fluffy bread, homemade sweet marinara sauce, and stunningly fresh ingredients as toppings. The pasta was also cooked to perfect and the salad was yummy. I really highly recommend checking this place out!!
author: Taline M.

description:
Wow... I used to think there wasn't room for more pizza in North Beach. After having a most delicious lunch at Piccolo Forno, it feels like a North Beach staple that has been there all along. The food was remarkably flavorful, with the pasta and crust tasting like it was made that morning. Try the gnocchi!

The owner, Giuseppe, is one the most genuine people you'll meet and he takes great pride in this place that he opened with his own sweat and equity. Wonderful spot all around!
author: Trav K.

description: Nice restaurant with good service and really good food.  Not a ding for me, but be aware they do not serve alcohol, though you can buy from a store around the corner and they do not charge a corking fee.  Pasta and pizza were both good.
author: Matt T.

description: We love the pizza and love Giuseppe! He was so sweet, his service was great and he went over and beyond to make his customers happy. Love this spot coming back again soon!
author: Christine L.

description:
I've only eaten their pizza. Buffalina and the prosciutto. Both are great thin crust pizzas, I prefer the buffalina. The pizza crust is to die for. I've eaten  at a lot of "famous" pizza places in SF but this one is definitely my favorite.

Order 2 pizzas and a side (burrata is delicious) for a nice wholesome meal for two.
author: Dylan M.

description: BEST homemade tiramisu I've ever had! The owner makes it himself along with many of the other desserts. Ive been here plenty of times and ALL the house made pasta dishes are FANTASTIC. They also have great to go pizza. The place is modern and friendly. The portobello ravioli in the cream sauce, the bolognese, and any special they offer is WORTH it! Will forever be a Piccolo Forno fan:)
author: Niaz N.

description:
Real deal here.  Possibly the best Italian I've ever had! Owner Giuseppe personally checks on you, he's such a nice guy. 
Amazing food, even basics like spaghetti and meatballs and pizza are masterfully done. Just look at these pictures they're practically glowing!!!
author: Chad C.

description:
Avoid this restaurant unless you wished to get reprimanded by the waiter when he gives you the wrong dish and salad. And then he makes fun of you with the other waiter in front of the customers. 

The waiter, thinning brown hair, thin frame 5'9" speaks broken English. My son ordered the capricciosa pizza but the waiter kept saying caprese salad. My wife and son both corrected him and told him it was the pizza. He then brought over the caprese salad along with a Caesar salad when we ordered the arugula salad. When we told him we did not order the caprese salad he got very hostile and insisted we did until I finally said we would keep it as I was concerned about how angry he had become. At that point we did not mention the second mistake.  They did not chargeus for the caprese salad 

Also they make their Italian sodas with sprite; instead of soda water and Italian syrup. The food was very  good and a new waiter took over, but we will never comeback.
author: John L.

description: Great little spot for delicious food! Meatballs were tasty! Pizza was very tasty as well! The homemade raviolis stuffed with crab were delicious! The pink sauce was creamy and smooth. My only complaint is that the raviolis were not very hot. I was a bit disappointed at the lukewarm temp of the food. Service was friendly and prompt.
author: Suzanne M.

description: I would say my dining experience at Piccolo Forno was worth the wait, as they were extremely busy and the wait was longer than I expected. I ordered a caesar salad and gnocchi with mozarella, marinara sauce and basil. The sauce was a bit too salty for my taste, but overall the dish was great.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Delicious pizzas and pastas.  I recently started a gluten free diet and was thrilled with the number of gluten free choices at this restaurant.  They'll make any pizza a or pasta on the menu in a gluten free version.  The gluten free pizza crust was delicious.  Unfortunately I live in LA or I would be a regular customer. I look forward to going back the next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Danna K.

description: By far my favorite pizza in the city, next to Delfina. Not too thin, not too heavy. Crust is just right and they're always consistent. I recommend the ideale. Also the service is fantastic!
author: Julian C.

description: one of my favorite restaurants in little italy! the owners are so kind and the food is fantastic - we love giuseppe!!!
author: Lea C.

description:
This has to be one of my new favorite Italian restaurants in SF! It is perfect for anyone looking for a quick bite of Italian food without the high prices that are common throughout the city. Me and a group of friends ended up here around 3pm after doing some sightseeing. The host was extremely friendly and had us seated immediately at a table of our choosing. Right after, he took our drink orders and brought us fresh bread and flavored oils to enjoy while waiting for our food. He kept making jokes and kept us entertained while taking our orders and bring out our food. 

At Piccolo Forno, not only is the hospitality amazing but also the food! Each of us got a different entree including the daily special an amazing butternut squash ravioli, cheese tortellini in red sauce, a margarita pizza topped generously with fresh arugula, and a panini. The menu selection is very wide and has something for everyone. All of our dishes were prepared to perfection and we had no complaints! The food was fresh, light yet extremely filling, and overall the perfect casual meal.
author: Prathna M.

description: Great service and great food. Had a special of hand made cheese tortellini with meat sauce and pizza. Both were good the pasta was GREAT! Would go here again.
author: Stacey R.

description: My wife, baby daughter, and I needed a place to sit down, rest up, and eat after an afternoon of walking around the north beach and wharf area.  We popped in to this place and decided to sit outside since it was nice weather and more spacious for our baby.  The waiter was great and constantly made sure we were doing okay and interacted with our daughter.  The food was great; the prosciutto was delicious with a nice airy crust and wonderful parmesan cheese slices, the lobster ravioli was light and the pasta shells you could tell was made fresh, and the pasta carbonara was eggy and light unlike typical pasta carbonaras that is heavy - pleasantly surprised.  Overall we had a wonderful experience.
author: Raymond F.

description: I tried the pizza here. The one with the egg. It was okay! My boyfriend had the crab ravioli which was very delicious! I will come back just for the crab ravioli!! This place is very casual in comparison to the very nice and fancy restaurants in the area. I was on my lunch break and it was a Friday afternoon about 2pm. Absolutely no one else in the restaurant but us and the workers who were absolutely fantastic. Thank you!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
After a chilly ride on the cable car to walk down the zig zag of Lombard street we were hungry for something warm and filling. 

Once we reached Columbus and Lombard we quickly checked for reviews of nearby Italian restaurants knowing that competition would be fierce and a restaurant with good reviews was bound to do the trick. 

We walked by a couple and chose Piccolo Forno as it looked clean, modern casual and reminiscent of our recent travels to Italy... we knew it was going to be authentic! 

The owner seated us and presented us with a concise 2-page menu in a native Italian accent. We chatted briefly about where he was from, his history in the restaurant business after leaving Italy, first in Toronto and then San Francisco. Apparently he also owns another full service Italian restaurant in the city. 

We ordered a pizza with buffalo mozzarella, arugula and shaved Parmesan. The pizza was thin and crispy with what we could tell were simple quality ingredients. As in Italy it wasn't over seasoned and seemed like a Neapolitan pizza but a little different cooked in an electric oven. The crust was crispy and not chewy as if wood burning. 

We then ordered a side of meatballs which were delicious. The tomato sauce was a little salty but rustic and addictive. 

For our mains, we had 3 pastas, cheese tortellini with a creamy Alfredo sauce, penne with eggplant and buffalo mozzarella with tomato sauce and fresh basil and finally linguine Vongole with a very healthy serving of clams. All were very tasty, plentiful and made simply and light without much fuss as Italian food should be. 

There is no question that this is authentic real Italian food, not NY style Italian American. 

The only heads up is that they do not have a liquor license. You are able to bring your own wine with no corkage fee and there is a wine store right next door although not open on Sundays.....yes, we visited on Sunday! 

Great value for quality, no frills, just excellent food. If you have or have not been, this is what Italy tastes like!
author: Jefferson H.

description:
I have to say I was a little disappointed. I chose this restaurant because of its high yelp rating. I even spoke with my waiter and asked for what he thought would be the most delicious dish on the menu. He recommended the veal tortellini which I agreed to and I also ordered a Caprese he salad which is a favorite for me. The Caprese was just so-so. Tomatoes were sliced too thin and the mozzarella was too thin as well. The tortellini was undercooked and still hard, and the sauce didn't have the big bold Italian flavor I was going for. 

This would be a better choice for someone who just wants a slice of pizza. The premium dishes were a disappointment. 

The service was good and the place was nice, but that's about it for highlights.  

The owner just messaged me and said I don't know what I'm talking about. That is terrible. 

I am now lowering my previous review of 3 stars to 1 star.  There was no malice in my review. It was honest. Now I am really disappointed that I ate there.

This owner just won't quit digging a hole for himself.  He just sent me this message:

giuseppe t: steve .u are rong ,I'm mast say ,the really italian place never put balsamic on caprese ,only american to that,, you can put zero star too ,I'm really don't care ,,u rong ,,have good day
author: Steve W.

description: Tasty pasta dishes - beef meatballs with spaghetti and all'arrabbiata spaghetti medium spice; my kidos devoured it! I enjoyed a GF pasta carbonara. Was thrilled GF was an option. If you are visiting Coit Tower it's a quick 10 minute walk. There is no wine menu but you are allowed to bring your own wine without a cork fee. There is a liquor store across from the park! Cheers. Good food and hospitality. Local vibe.
author: Erica M.

description: This place has good reviews, so we checked it out. Friendly staff. The Caprese salad was the tastiest part. Good seasoning, the capers added great flavor. I ordered chicken fettuccini Alfredo, and it was very watery, and the cream sauce wasn't too flavorful. I asked for a side of red sauce, which was much better tasting than the cream sauce. I wonder what the pizza is like.
author: Ashley A.

description:
I ordered some dishes to go and the owner was nice and the dishes were surprisingly tasty! I ordered the meat tortellini with meat sauce- LOVED this dish and wish it was on the regular menu. It was hand made and the meat sauce was really tasty. They even shredded some nice cheese on top which I appreciated because it was a take out order (they could have skimped on this).

I also ordered a margherita pizza which I thought was just OK. But the fresh bread that came with the meal was great- fresh out of the oven, warm soft and chewy middle with a crusty exterior, perfect with some good butter!
author: Jenny H.

description: Tasty and fresh homemade Italian food -- friendly and helpful wait staff. I had the penne arrabiata and the greca salad (wherever the dressing was, it was AMAZING!). They bring you fresh bread and olive oil while you wait for your entrees, and I really loved the spicy red chili flakes oil you can add to your food to make it spicy. The homemade pizzas looked amazing -- will have to try it next time!
author: Deepa K.

description:
It's nice to see an Italian place in North Beach that's actually good, very good as a matter of fact. The terrific Italian Homemade Company is just across the street, so maybe this stretch of Columbus is looking to offset the overcrowded tourist traps that lie just down the street. Funny thing was that Jamie W. and I came here on an early Friday evening around 6:30PM and found the place nearly desolate. Odd timing, I surmised, since the place is quite welcoming in an unobtrusive, contemporary way, and diners indeed started to trickle in after us. Owner Giuseppe Terminiello greeted us and generously gave us a table for four as he probably saw us as guys with big appetites. He was right, but we managed to exert some self-control.

I wasn't aware that Giuseppe is also the owner of Ristorante Ideale, one of the few eateries on that stretch of Grant Avenue that serves good Italian dishes worthy of a return visit (review: http://bit.ly/2d5kwK4). The menu here is more casual with an equal emphasis on pizza which is on full appetizing display on the counter (photo: http://bit.ly/2ehdV4h). Still, we were both in a pasta mood, but first, we wanted to try the $12.50 Burrata with Prosciutto and Arugula (photo: http://bit.ly/2dXS8uv). That was startlingly good with the burrata the perfect creamy texture topped with just enough olive oil to make the arugula and prosciutto the most compatible of accompaniments. In fact, the complimentary bread made the ideal vessel for all the goodness (photo: http://bit.ly/2dp8nAF).

Jamie's love of meatballs came to the fore with the $13 Spaghetti con Polpette di Manzo, which was a fresh treatment on an old-school classic with the trio of large beef meatballs providing carnivorous satisfaction full of seasoning (photo: http://bit.ly/2e5PpnI). I decided to go for one of their daily specials, the $15 Spaghetti Carbonara, which nicely blended eggs, pecorino and Parmesan cheeses, and cubes of pancetta (photo: http://bit.ly/2ddrlN5). It brought hearty satisfaction in a manageable portion. Believe it or not, we stopped short of ordering dessert even though the menu included the usual suspects: tiramisu, profiteroles, gelato and sorbetto. No, we were strong...at least until we looked at the cannolis at Stella Pastry five minutes after we left.  

FOOD - 4 stars...traditional Italian but given a fresh quality treatment
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...more spacious and a cleaner look than most trattorias in the area
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...Giuseppe and his crew care about his customers
TOTAL - 4 stars...this could become a regular habit for us paisans
author: Ed U.

description:
This place has the best ravioli. The owner is from Amalfi coast, Capri. Very authentic ravioli. Totally worth your money. We had the butternut squash ravioli and the asparagus. 

The owner is so kind and almost personalizes the food depending on what you like. He is very open to different kinds of orders. 

Do try the ravioli and ask him to suggest because these raviolis were out of the world
author: Kruthi S.

description: Really good pizza. A friend and I wandered in here on a touristy night in the city and couldn't even tel they were closing because they told us they were still open and treated us so nice. The pizzas were out in 10 minutes and the prosciutto crudo and Margh were fireeeeee. The staff were super cool. Super authentic Italian pizza.
author: Arielle M.

description: Ate here a few weeks ago.  Very good and reasonable prices.  North Beach has many authentic Italian restaurants and this one of the best.  The location is easy to find and staff was very friendly.
author: Phil S.

description: Found this place on Yelp with good reviews so we went there today after walking the Golden Gate Bridge. Excellent service and the food was great. We had the lasagna and a pepperoni/sausage pizza. We will definitely go there again the next time we spend the day in beautiful San Francisco!
author: Rose A.

description:
Found this small Italian bistro while walking down Columbus Avenue with my roommate. He got in to grab a bite of pizza and an something caught my attention while casually browsing the menu. They appeared to have a dessert I used to love when growing up as a kid in Rome. It's a Lemon Sorbetto stuffed in a real lemon shell. The owner said he gets it delivered directly from Italy.

Since then I'm often at this place just to get my Sorbetto. I love the place.
author: Luca G.

description: Terrific penne all a arrabbiata. A bit of a wait on Saturday night. No reservations... walk-in only. Bring own wine or buy next door until they get liquor license.  Fast service. Excellent food... fettuccini Alfredo and cheese tortellini with meatballs.
author: Shane B.

description:
Simple and positive review for this place. Good food that was authentic, fresh as delicious. Spot was awesome location with a great seat/table right next to the window. Menu was large and full of many great and diverse choices. 
Only thing holding back a five star was the waiter was overworked, serving all 8 tables at once. The man in the back making salads and pizzas was not as busy and could have helped alleviate the business of the dinner rush. He did after an hour at the end of the meal. Also, there were two tables that got a free dessert at the end of their meal for waiting a little longer for their meal. We waited as well but did not get a free dessert. Not sure why. Maybe noticeably non-locals?
Either way, I would go back definitely as the food and spot was fresh, delicious and authentic Italian.
author: Jon H.

description: Amazing food! Very fast service And very friendly! Our friend Pepe is the best he take care very good of his restaurant
author: G R.

description:
We went here on Sunday afternoon and ordered the lasagna, spaghetti with meatballs and spaghetti carbonara. 

The lasagna was great. The noodles you can tell are homemade because they're soft and thin and the sauce is just right, not too tangy.

The spaghetti and meatballs was alright. The pasta was perfect but it was drowning in sauce and I personally don't like that much sauce. The sauce was also too tangy for my taste. The meatballs were good though.

My sister had the spaghetti carbonara and she didn't like it at all. It had a bad aftertaste and had curdled eggs. She's had carbonara at Buca di Beppo and loved it and even made it herself and it was better then this.

The service was pretty good. The bread they gave us was nothing like the bread in previous yelp posts. It was really small and hard not a big soft loaf like in the pics. After the 2nd bread refill I think he stopped checking on our table so he wouldn't have to refill our bread again. Lol

Overall it's pretty good. Just order the lasagna and you'll be fine.
author: Ashley F.

description: Food is excellent, very authentic. Owner is super friendly and I loved the Italian music!  Reminded me of my grandma's cooking!
author: Mark G.

description:
Came here on a weeknight, and was seated quite quickly. We ordered the crab ravioli and prosciutto and arugula pizza. They were both really good, although not mind-blowingly innovative or anything. Just really good quality ingredients and excellent preparation. The ravioli pasta were toothsome, fresh, yet thin, and with great crab flavor and tomato sauce with cherry (or small) tomatoes to add some brightness. The pizza was thin crust, with super fresh dough, and a good balance of flavors between the bitter arugula, salty\meaty prosciutto, and a fresh\sweet tasting sauce. 

Best of all, it was pretty reasonably priced (maybe $33 for the two dishes, with leftovers)! Not bad for North Beach. 

No beer/wine/cocktails though.
author: B Y.

description: We loved this place, felt so authentic, probably family owned, everything was fantastic from the appetizer to the dessert. I don't remember the exact name of the dishes (they need a website, desperately) but we had, appetizer: the bread with mozzarella and anchovies sauce (it was AMAZING, a must). The Pizza Pugliese and the Tortellini ai 3 formaggi as entrees. And Profiterole and Mocha for dessert. Everything was really good, you have to try this place. 100% recommended.
author: Jonnathan J.

description:
Walking through North Beach while thumbing through Yelp options, we found Piccolo online and in person at about the same time.  Turns out 0.02 miles away translates to "you are standing in front of the restaurant".

While vacillating over the menu, a very friendly server called us in, walked us through his favorite options, and persuaded us to take a seat.  The service remained exceptional for the remainder of the meal.  In casual conversation, the servers speak with a heavy Italian accent, which was simultaneously charming and tricky to decipher.

The layout of Piccolo is very open; there's the tables in the front, a display case of all the options, and to go to the bathroom you walk through the kitchen (which you can also see clearly from the table).  There is nothing to hide, of course; just people rolling dough and making pizza.

We ordered the ideal, $16 with arugula, tomato and a hard cheese.  It arrived in roughly 25 minutes.  Thin crust, so didn't take up much space in my stomach.  After wolfing down my half, still felt vaguely hungry but that went away after a bit.  Ah, the miracles of digestion.  Then, since we were in a bit of a rush, we walked up to the iPad cash register to split the bill and head out.

I don't know if it's the best pizza I've ever had, but a charming meal in a friendly environment deserves at least 4 stars.
author: Emily Y.

description:
I just ate the portobella ravioli special. It might be the greatest dish I have ever eaten.

Great authentic place. Amazing food.

I wish I could give them 10 out of 5 stars.
author: Eric S.

description: Delicious pizza! Wonderful and friendly staff. Will definitely be back to try the pasta.
author: Ilana S.

description: Boring pizza  the crust was good but the sauce was bland and the "spicy" salami was mild.
author: Manny F.

description: Delicious, authentic pasta! We started with burrata, which was super creamy and came with a great prosciutto. Rustic homemade bread with high quality olive oil was complementary. My husband had the sea bass ravioli that was on special and I had the ricotta gnocchi. The gnocchi may be the best I ever had. Definitely top three....and my mom is italian so that is saying a lot. The service was top notch and they also have BYOW, at no corking fee.
author: Libbi W.

description: Was craving some pizza and ran across this lil' spot.  Prompt and quick service.  Reasonable prices and tasty food.  You can taste the quality and authenticity in every bite.
author: Yadi G.

description:
Simple Italian comfort food, relaxing chill ambiance, and very friendly staff! 

Affordable yummy pastas. Came for lunch on a Sunday around noon and it was pretty empty. My friend and I were wondering where all the people were since this place has a Yelp rating of 4.5

We decided to order lasagna and spaghetti carbonara. It was a really nice day and the restaurant had the front door open which let the breeze and warmth of the sun in. Ah...felt great to be sitting right near the door. 

By 12:30pm, the place was filled with people, and majority of them were Italians! All seemed to be speaking Italian with the restaurant staff (most likely owner?). Our pastas were simple but perfectly cooked. each plate was around $15. We ended the meal with tiramisu - omg sooooo good. We gobbled that up in a second and licked every bit of it off the plate. Will be back to try more pastas!
author: Rohenne L.

description: Extremely nice people work in here and the food is good. I asked the owner if I could charge my phone inside the restaurant and he gladly helped me. The sauce on the pizza was very light and flavorful. I recommend you eat here. People with warm loving hearts work here.
author: Becky G.

description: It really taste good.  Anyone should try it the pasta and pizza is very good! Service is really personal owner come out with cold water to take your order.
author: Roy T.

description: Came here last week for a quick lunch with a friend who is a regular here. We shared the Caprese and Vegetarian pizza dough sandwiches and I'm just in love with the bread they use for it! The filling is very simple: tomatoes/cheese, cheese/seasonal veggies but it works somehow. Staff were friendly, I am not sure why some reviews say otherwise. Would like to give a 3.5 but gotta round up for nice people!
author: Sadia I.

description:
I am particularly jaded when it comes to most Italian food. Mainly because it's so darn filling. And today's general trend towards avoiding carbs. 

I've been here twice and I've got to say, Piccolo Forno makes me appreciate pizza again. Both times we got the Capricciosa and a caesar salad. It was so good the first time we had to have the same exact meal again the second time. The pizza dough was a perfect thickness, neither too thick or too thin and just the right amount of chewiness. The toppings of artichoke, olives, prosciutto, mushroom and a runny egg was such a lovely and unique combination of savory goodness. And extra kudos for serving chili in chili oil as an accompaniment.

But what pushes this place over the edge is the amazing hospitality and especially of the main guy who seems as though he is the owner. He shared with us his last glass of wine (I hope that doesn't get him in trouble!) after we found out this was a BYOW/B kind of place.

The second time we went, we were sure to bring our bottle. Next time we will try the pasta.

Each time, there is sounds of Italian being spoken among the people who work there and even among other patrons and that gives the ambience in here an extra special feel.
author: S. S.

description: This is such a great little place! Great service,fresh ingredients and reasonably priced! My husband and I shared a simple house salad of mixed greens,a margarita pizza and the Bucatini pasta- so delicious as well as a beautiful dessert recommended  followed by a lovely cappuccino! While you may bring your own beer or wine to consume,they don't sell alcoholic beverages. We will be back!
author: M M.

description: Cute place. No liquor license, but there is a small wine shop next door where you can buy a bottle to enjoy with your meal. We had a salad, pasta, and pizza. The salad was fresh, but simple. The pasta was delicious. The pizza (prosciutto) had two sheets of prosciutto placed on top, which we had to cut appropriately for each slice, and that made for a messy presentation, but still tasty.
author: Robin A.

description: Holy cow. Great food and even better service  it's so hard to find great Italian food these days.
author: christina d.

description:
The Ristorante Ideale guys opened this new gem on Columbus.  This block used to be pretty sleepy, but no more.  Thanks to Italian Homemade opening, the Petite Deli reopening, & now Piccolo, this block is now wide awake.

A thoroughly positive experience all the way around.  It's very casual, & the staff treat you like family.  The food is authentic.  It's a win-win.  

Piccolo, like Ideale, shines w flavors that are so clean, that cleanliness comes out in a strong way.  That's one of the biggest strengths a kitchen can have.  

The pizza Diavola was as delicious as ever (it's on the menu at Ideale, too).  Perfectly crispy thin crust.  Sauce like nonna's.  Spicy salami.  Simple, fresh, & quality that you can taste.

Both neighboring tables ordered the gnocchi.  The aroma was intoxicating.  That scent of uber fresh basil filled me w regret for not ordering it, though I have had it at Ideale a few times.

Fabulous home cooking.  Good people.  That's what you'll find here.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Their service is amazing! Even though they don't have many servers, their attentiveness is superb!

After 6pm, they came by and served us complimentary gelato. 

Definitely will be back soon!!!
author: Y T.

description:
One fantastic small place! BYOB, no corkage, no on sale license either. 

Great pizza, bread, crab ravioli, etc. 

Service was by far the best ever!

Highly recommended!
author: Mike B.

description: Great pizza and homemade tiramisu! Owner also also doesn't charge a corkage fee if you bring your own bottle, no alcohol sold here but you can bring your own.
author: Alejandro S.

description:
Piccolo Forno gets me excited about the future of North Beach eateries. Located a couple of blocks down Columbus from the cluster of carbon copy tourist tarps, Piccolo Forno (along with The Italian Homemade Company) offers a simple and relaxed - yet contemporary approach to Italian dining. 

Open and clean interior gives off a relaxed vibe. No stuffy and fussy service but rather a straightforward and personable approach to hospitality. The same applies to the menu. Pizza slices, calzones, and pasta dishes along with a variety of antipasti and salads. The namesake Piccolo Forno pizza is almost a take on a niscoise salad in a pie. You won't even miss the fact that there isn't cheese on it with the nice combination of flavor between the tuna, artichoke, olives, tomatoes, and egg - it's very tasty. I can't wait to come back to try more of the menu. 

Piccolo Forno is a casual Italian eatery with quality food at affordable prices - a departure from places up the street but definitely a win for the neighborhood.
author: Jon L.

description:
Chanced on this place, given strong yelp reviews. The place across the street was busier, but the owner talked us in. So glad he did. 

First, the bread. I could eat this all day, and my youngest was in heaven. Ordered the Arugula salad and Caprese salad, so flavorful. Next, meatballs on the side, ravioli, and the prosciutto and arugula pizza. Just awesome, the crust was so delicious and the sauce was perfect. Finished with gelato and cappuccino. The check was extremely reasonable for the quality and my family of four was stuffed and happy.

We've visited Italy and the pasta and pizza are hard to replicate, but this place nails it. Don't be put off by the decor, which looks like a graphic designer went a bit overboard, the food is the real deal.
author: Dave G.

description: Lovely place and original Italien food, friendly staff! Small but fine place to enjoy ur pasta, pizza :)
author: Sam I.

description: Fabulous local place. Everyone was speaking Italian. My ravioli dish was perfectly cooked and our waiter was so warm and friendly and welcoming
author: Heather L.

description: The food was amazing!  This place is fun and the staff is friendly and very helpful.  Everyone's dinner was delicious, even my gluten-free pasta which can be questionable sometimes.  This was exactly the kind of experience we were looking for.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Some of the best Italian food I've ever had.

I got the Lobster Ravioli - stuffed very nicely and the pasta, sauce, and filling was very obviously fresh and handmade. Very good.

My dad got the Crab Ravioli - a little less stuffed than the Lobster but still amazing quality and taste. I personally prefer lobster but if you're getting multiple don't rule this out. 

My brother got the pizza with tuna and onions. I would never order it but it was surprisingly good. Everything was fresh tasting, I think I just don't like tuna. If you do it was very well made though.

The salad was very good, I'd ask for more vinaigrette but it was very fresh.

The margherita pizza was fairly standard but perfectly executed. One of the best crusts and sauces I've ever had.

Service was excellent, you can tell it's a small place and everyone is very friendly and Italian too. Very authentic feel.

If I was in town again I would come back for sure. Definitely check this out if you're in the Bay area.
author: Bruce W.

description: This is I think the best Italian place...the food are amazing and the prize are modest... people are super friendly and ultra available..guys try the tiramisu!!!
author: Federico F.

description: With all the positive reviews,  I was looking forward to some good Italian. First, I ordered a slice of cheese pizza.  Unfortunately, it was bland and wished I got a slice from Golden Boy instead.  I ordered the cheese tortellini in marinara sauce.  Again, it was bland but even worse the pasta was overcooked and mushy and tasted like a can of Chef Boyardee.  I know I am being harsh and perhaps I came on a bad day but for the price, it was sad.
author: avi a.

description: This place excellent. Ive been looking for a place like this for a while. It reminds me of my honeymoon when I got to go to Italy and had my first real Italian meal  (instead of the Chicago style I grew up with, which was still good but different and heavier tasting). The burratta was one of the best things I've had in a long time and the ravioli had this light fresh acidic tomato sauce on them. Honestly think it's better than Italian homemade across the street.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Absolutely delicious! You may have to wait a bit for a table but trust me it's so worth it. The pesto is the best I have ever had, also the tiramisu is SOO GOOD. The owners are so friendly as well. T was overall an amazing experience. I will for sure stop by next time I'm in San Fran!!!
author: Ana H.

description:
Earlier, before dinner, he showed me a picture of us from nearly 20 years ago. He said that it was taken on the first day we met. My first instinct was that dated me, I did not like to look at me when I was in my prime. But wait, on second thought, I should, and it seemed that I looked exactly the same, hiding behind sunglasses and hat (I'm that vain, yes.)  Perhaps because staring at my old self smiling back me made me hungry, we went to fetch food.

Owner is italian. He told us that this is a 2 and half weeks old restaurant. It felt very European. I did not catch the owner's name, who greeted us warmly.  We did the dine in version vs. take out.  My companion used to run a Yelp like site before there was Yelp. I think it's because he's extremely observant, often have smart things to say about anything that interests him, and he's a people person. I'm not a people person. I'd like to eat in peace and not talk. He observed that the owner was in a talkative mode. "He could tell that we were locals so he chatted with us."

I liked the ambience of the new place. It felt neighborly, local, even though it's just a block away from the tourist trap. The restaurant appeared to be easy on the eyes. Whatever they did, it works. 

I could see that the owner was making a caesar salad in the kitchen. He tossed it by hand. Just enough times so that the lettuce could stay crisp, yet the dressing was mixed in. Interesting technique. 

The counter displayed a wide array of premade pizza and things. A man who appears to be a local worker stopped by to order a piece of pizza. The owner told him that it's free, it's getting to be end of the day, clearly they know each other, and he was being very generous. So incredibly kind. You don't see that often enough. 

The salad arrived with the pasta. It's all freshly made. The meatball was crunchy outside and soft inside. The pasta was al dente. If you google spaghetti meatballs, the google image would show that dish. Their pasta is stock image ready. The caesar salad had just enough anchovies, which is my favorite thing in a caesar. I think it is most likely the best I've ever had. Most of the caesar salads we eat in America is ladled with dressing. This one was light and intense at the same time.

When the bill came he went, "Wow." I asked why, he said that it was very inexpensive. I did not offer to pay. He won't take my money anyway. But I'm glad I was not the usual expensive date for once. 

That evening was full of surprises. I received my belated birthday presents from him, I had not anticipated anything really; I saw what I looked like nearly 20 years ago and I had not really changed that much at all, except I think I'm more in shape now even though I was not out of shape before; I had met the owner of this neighborly restaurant who is kind, ernest, and talented in the kitchen, which proves to me good people are still around; and I finally found a caesar salad I liked...

Welcome to the neighborhood. Please stay.
author: Victoria E.

description: Great food! Worth the wait in line! I highly recommend this place if you like Italian food.
author: Jonah J.

description: Second time here and it was just like the first, exceptional service and food. Kids live the pizza and Caesar as well as their Italian sodas. Burrata was amazing. Spaghetti a la carbonara was the best as well as there fettuccini Alfredo. Something unique about the place is that they do not serve alcohol here but welcome you to being your own bottle of wine and they will bring you glasses with no corkage fee. A place we will continue to visit every time we are in the area.
author: Dario G.

description: Amazing pizza!!! Super fresh and extremely tasty!!! Stumbled across this place waking to somewhere else and stopped in!  So glad we did! Bring your own wine!! Delightful! Great Service too!!!
author: Dre D.

description: Came after a full day of sightseeing and little eating. Perfect find. It is small but we were greeted and seated right away. Welcoming and friendly service. Felt right at home in this casual atmosphere. They don't serve liquor but we were kindly informed there is no corkage fee and wine is sold next door.  Gnocchi, lasagne and pizza were all delicious. Desserts (tiramisu and panna cotta) were amazing.  Not super fancy, super good.
author: Kere V.

description: Came here after a visit to Coit Tower. 15 min walk all down hill. Arrived at 5:00pm, greeted very warmly. Staff authentic Italian. Food superb. Tables filled early by both locals and tourists. Recommended highly.
author: David O.

description:
We are  up here in San Francisco on vacation and have decided to order some Italian food there about a mile and a half away if you try to have them delivered to your hotel I recommend you ordering ahead of time way ahead of 
time. We've decided to try the Philly cheesesteak and also the chicken cheesesteak the food was excellent.  Even order the cheesecake which we haven't had to yet but it does look delicious. I do recommend you going to eat or get it to go and bring it back to your hotel or home I know what we had is an Italian food but it's totally worth it was delicious.
author: R B.

description: If you're looking for authentic Italian this is definitely where you should be. I'm from New York City and they could put some Italian restaurants in New York City out of business. The fresh ingredients and great customer service are what really make this restaurant absolutely amazing. You can definitely tell it's a family owns and operated business. The hostess/waiter was very genuine and funny with his customers. Across the street is The Italian Homemade Company which I've eaten at before and Piccolo Forno is definitely a better restaurant. The price is very reasonable as well. Don't waste you're time anywhere else. I'll definitely be back again.
author: Imani M.

description: Buonissimo!!! Fresh pasta make it in place and very friendly staff. A taste of Italy in the heart of North Beach. You will not disappointed!
author: Gaetano B.

description: We had amazing service and food at Piccolo Forno! We would highly recommend to any friends visiting that want delicious Italian food!
author: Sarah M.

description: I ordered the pizza with artichokes, olives, prosciutto, and egg. This is a city with truly phenomenal food, and this pizza was exemplary. More, the staff were genuinely kind and really cared about your experience. Cannot recommend enough!
author: Anna M.

description: Delicious pasta, and the price is just right. Warm atmosphere. Life advice when you need it. Italian being spoken, and Spanish. Many neighborhood elderlies stop in to chat with the servers, which makes it feel so homey. Love this place, it's very comforting and they let me sit and draw and chat for as long as I please, make me cappuccinos to go, check on my often. This is my neighborhood cozy spot and it never gets so busy that I feel harried or like I'm being ignored. The only thing missing is they don't serve alcohol, which I'm hoping will change soon so I can enjoy a glass of cab with my pasta. Regardless, I love sending people this way when they ask for my recommendation as I work in the neighborhood. Ti amo Piccolo Forno!!!
author: Justine K.

description: Best Italian restaurant I've been to since Italy.  Pesto special was perfection, and vegetable dish was perfect.  Great service, will definitely be here again.
author: Gregg P.

description: This place was so good I came here two weekends in a row! My favorite dish was the lobster ravioli (AMAZING), but the crab ravioli and arrabiata were delicious as well. The interior is super cute and cozy and I appreciated the modern art on the wall. The server speaks with such a thick Italian accent that I felt like I was in Italy. :) I wish I hadn't been too full for dessert!
author: Elyse W.

description:
Piccolo Forno just opened a few days ago, and I tried it out for lunch today. With the Italian Homemade just across the street, it's great to see North Beach moving farther north.

I had a slice of the mushroom pizza and two supplis (fried rice balls). The mushroom pizza was pretty good - the crust was thick but crispy. Similar in style to Golden Boy, but thinner and crispier. The sauce and toppings were tasty as well. The owner mentioned that they're expecting a new pizza oven from Italy soon, so perhaps the pizzas will change a bit when it arrives.

The supplis were very interesting, and I had not tried them before. They appear to be fried risotto, mixed with bolognese sauce and parmesan cheese, then breaded and fried. They were very tasty. Although they heated them up for me when I ordered them, they were still a bit cool in the center.

Overall, Piccolo Forno is a nice addition to North Beach, and I'll definitely be back.
author: Allen T.

description: Really, really nice place for lunch on Columbus. The service could not have been friendlier, (wisely) treating my two kids as any other customers. I wasn't sure who was happier to get to speak Italian: the waitstaff or my kids, who had been to Italy for a few weeks and missed the food and culture. The pizzas are all excellent, as is the Burrata w/Prosciutto appetizer. I'll definitely be back here, and not only for family time.
author: Aviah M.

description: Absolutely love this local gem. The food is amazing and very reasonably  priced, the staff is warm, friendly and attentive. Best part: bring your own wine with no corkage fee! I visited twice in one week and will be back many times. Grab a table near the front if you run warm as some heat does come off the kitchen from the pizza oven.
author: Jessica H.

description: The owner was incredibly friendly and the food was great! We had a baptism planned down the street and needed to do a simple party for a group of 17. The owner went out of his way to fit us in to this small quaint restaurant and we felt so special. Food was excellent and the atmosphere was clean and lovely! Loved it
author: Jennifer C.

description:
For under $6 I got a tasty corner slice of pizza with egg, olives, tuna, tomatoes, and I think mozzarella. Crispy but chewy, and bursting with fresh tomato.

When you walk in, there is a display of all the food options, and the staff is so friendly. The owner,m and chef, who is from Capri, chatted with me and even brought me extra utensils and napkins. There's also wifi - just ask for the password.

Would definitely recommend!
author: Grace Y.

description: I had the margarita pizza . The dough was so light and airy. The sauce was simply delicious and mozzarella was fresh . The complimentary bread was to die for ! Airy and a little crunchy on the outside ! Wow one of the best bread I have had . Next time I visit I have to try their pastas and salads . I kept glancing at my neighbors food because it looked an smelled so delicious ! Ahh can't wait to come back and visit this warm and friendly place that has amazing food. Thanks for the great service !
author: Jamie T.

description:
Super authentic Italian place. Fresh fresh pasta, trendy atmosphere, and phenomenal personal service. Italian owner is passionate about his restaurant and very friendly.

Food: Best Fettuccine Alfredo I've ever had. Margherita Pizza was also delicious.
author: Kaz H.

description: Hands down best ravioli I ever had! I had the special of the night portobello ravioli and the sauce was to die for. Service was great. Ambiance was excellent, very clean. Will definitely make it back here when I'm in town!
author: Michael B.

description:
So came to the Chinatown Moon Festival event and wanted something to eat. Chinatown was packed with people and kind of wanted something different, so decided for Italian. So went to Yelp and was looking for something for a high rating, found Italian Homemade Company and this place which was right across the street. So it was going to be one or the other.

I went to Italian Homemade Company and seen as I stated in their rating all they had were stools inside, meaning not kid friendly. The table and chair option was only outside, didn't want to sit outside and smell the people walking by.

So I came here and ordered the special of the day and my partner ordered a classic dish. We were given some fresh baked bread with some olive oil, would had like some balsamic vinegar too but didn't have. 

When the plates came I thought it was off the kids menu, until I thought about it. They didn't have a kid menu, and if they did how small would be the portions if the adult portion was already kid size. So the staff already noticed we were happy with the portions and asked if liked more bread. Of course we did, but the bread the second time around was stale. Most likely day old bread not even reheated. 

The pasta was good, nothing special other than the small size considering the price.
author: M C.

description: AMAZING Italian food. Everything was freshly made and hot as the food was brought out. Ordered lasagna, fettuccini, margherita pizza, and caprese salad. All were amazing. Definitely will return on the next trip to SF!
author: Ainoki T.

description: Best Italian food I've had. If you're looking for pasta that makes you feel like you're eating in Italy, then this is the place for you. The staff is super friendly and the service is impeccable! Highly recommend it.
author: Tanya D.

description: Fantastic!  We were searching for an Italian restaurant and were starving.  We read the menu and grabbed a table.  The service was great, friendly servers and fast service.  The 4 of us had 2 arugula salads, a pizza and mushroom raviolis.  The salad was fresh with a delicious vinaigrette.  The mushroom raviolis were rich with a creamy sauce, they were incredibly rich so it is a good idea to share them.  We had the ideale pizza which was perfect.  My husband ordered the lemon tart which was divine.  Trendy, casual and fun atmosphere.  We will be back!
author: Kathy T.

description: This is a good and unpretentious Italian restaurant. I stopped by one night with a friend for a prosciutto and arugula pizza and spaghetti with meatballs. Both were very good and had a homemade, comfort food taste to them. It was more typical of what you will find on the East coast than here in SF. The owner is a real Italian and was very friendly. I will definitely stop by again when in the area and might take a trip there even before that. I highly recommend the pizza.
author: Tim Z.

description: This is an AWESOME quaint authentic Italian restaurant. Found it on yelp while roaming around SF and they grabbed a 2nd table so we could sit four of us outside to enjoy the walk by people. SUPER reasonable prices.
author: John W.

description: Great place!!!! Food was on point and dessert was delicious. The guys working there are very friendly. I will definitely be back to this place every time I want Italian and I am in the city
author: Ralph Y.

description:
Incredible. I would take this over any other "Italian restaurant" any day. Spaghetti is fantastic! A really cool/chill atmosphere yet feels like you're at a family owned joint. Which, you probably are. 
You'll regret it if you don't stop by!
author: Brexten P.

description: Very good Italian place. From pasta to pizza and everything in between. We had the 4 cheese pizza, chicken Alfredo and stuffed ravioli. Delicious! You can tell it's a little mom and pop place with great food! The previous reviews led us here. Great choice!
author: Carlos C.

description:
Based on the reviews we were expecting great food . Unfortunately the food was so salty . We ordered spaghetti& meatballs , and lasagna ... 
maybe we came on a off day? However , the lasagna was watery as well, possibly because they did not drain enough ? Either way ... wasn't worth the $$. Two stars because the service was quick
author: Cool C.

description:
Me and my friends went here two weeks ago. We deceived to eat here, because of all the positive reviews. At our arrival the waiter told us that we have to wait for 15min, apparently the tables were reserved for someone, but nobody came. 
Finally we got a table and ordered our meal.  We ordered two Spagetti carbonara and one Spagetti with meatballs, but what we got really disappointed us. The meatballs were frozen in the middle, the carbonara weren't only drastically different sizes but also the sauce looked more like scrambled eggs than a creamy sauce. Honestly, this is not acceptable for an Italian neighborhood! Wouldn't recommend!
author: Bunmi A.

description: I think the biggest thing that turned me off was a meat slicer with a slab of meat on the slicer that was next to the sole bathroom. Mushroom ravioli was ok, but almost anything with truffle oil is tasty. Pizza is about what you can get in any one of the fast fired pizza chains- pieology, pizza rev, mod pizza. I.E., nothing special
author: Cyndi L.

description:
I came across this place while visiting SF for business.  Charming place, mainly local Italians eating and hanging out speaking in Italian adding a great atmosphere to this little place.

I ordered the Burrata appetizer which was incredible. I also ordered a margarita pizza which I was not so thrilled about the crust. However, that said the man I presumed to be the owner noticed I only ate one slice and was not interested in taking it to go.
