He apologized that it was not to my liking and refused to let me pay for it. I offered to give me something else but, honestly I was already full from the burrata and prosciutto salad and the basket of awesome bread. Had a nice double espresso to finish the lunch. Overall, was a great experience.

I would go back again and recommend others to give it a try.
author: Ariel H.

description: Love, love, love this place! We came here the other night for my friends birthday and everything was wonderful. Not only was the service amazing, but the atmosphere was so cozy, and the food was delicious. Will definitely be coming back here!
author: Jessica D.

description:
I always thought authentic Italian pizza would taste bland because of how simple it looked, I was DEAD WRONG. This place truly brings out the flavors in each of its ingredients, a pizza margherita tastes more than just "cheese, basil, and crushed tomatoes" I don't know how to describe it other than the flavors run deeper than most simple pizzas I have ever eaten. 
The owner of the place is incredibly friendly and engaging with his costumers, he actually lured me in when I was just passing by, and I'm glad he did.
I will be back whenever I visit SF!
author: Crystal N.

description:
Fantastic food, fantastic ownership!

Great pizza, amazing ravioli and  tiramisu!!

The owner was very friendly and was the nicest guy
author: Dan A.

description: Pastas or delicious pizza is great so convenient and close to my house have eaten there four times in the past three months . Staff is so Italian polite charming and amazing!
author: Reneè S.

description: Here's a place so authentic, you feel as though you were casually dining on a side street off some quiet Roman piazza. It was intimate yet at the same time lively with conversations from other tables in Italian. One small child at the table next to ours was quite indecisive about his seat and meal, but overall pleasant and mannered. It simply added to the comfortable and laid back atmosphere. Giuseppe was an amazing host.
author: Teera G.

description: We were in the city visiting family and came here for dinner. Everything was amazing. I had the Gnocchi and my husband had the best Spaghetti and meatballs. The Caesar salad was perfect also! Will definitely come here again, next time we are in North Beach!
author: Kristen S.

description: This place is amazing! The lobster ravioli is out of this world and I haven't had better gnocchi anywhere in sf. Bring your own wine, no corkage fee and settle in for some mouth watering pasta!
author: Stephen W.

description:
The food, the service, the quality overall - 5 stars!

Our waiter (presumably the owner) was welcoming, attentive, and carried a very charismatic demeanor which made our dining experience even more enjoyable. 

The chicken fettuccini alfredo was the best I've ever had... no exaggeration. 

Note: they do not sell wine, but go ahead and ask the owner about your options. He will not disappoint!
author: Lexy C.

description: This place is ridiculously good, reasonably priced, and the owner is a great guy. The only minus is the pizza by the slice (rectangle) is not the same crust as the pizza if you buy a whole pie (round). The latter is awesome, the former is just ok.
author: Mike W.

description: Giuseppe is probably the most genuine guy in north beach, I love their pastas  also the portions are nice , affordable price cool environment, I strongly recommend this spot is one of few authentic restaurant .
author: Nicola C.

description:
Ohh yeah. This is a great place. The pizza by the slide tastes like the authentic pizza al taglio back in Italy. So good!!!!!!!
I ordered some pizza and a coffee and the waiter told me: but the coffee for after you have finished the pizza.
Yeap. That's how things should be served, not just the coffee together with the pizza.
Fantastic.
A must try for anybody going to north beach!!!
author: Luca R.

description: Wow! Delicious pasta and pizza at a very reasonable price.  Tasted fresh and highlighted the flavors in true Italian fashion. Not over sauced or over salty, just basic exceptional food.
author: Joana B.

description: Small cute, clean restaurant with Amazing food!! Everything from the salad to the spaghetti, the pizza was Delicious!!!! We had the homemade sausage & mushrooms pizza and we loved it! They do not serve wine or beer, but we picked some up about a block & half away and the owner allowed us to drink it with our meal. Believe me you will not be disappointed! Prices are good and the food is authentic yummy!!
author: Lisa V.

description: Fist off, bring your own bottle of wine. They do not sell any but also they do not charge a corkage fee. Small and some what intimate, with extremely friendly service. The food was fresh and delicious. We had the insalata mista, arugula with pecorino, pasta puttanesca and spaghetti with meatballs. All was delicious. We enjoyed ourselves tremendously.
author: Waylon W.

description:
Bravo Piccolo Forno! I've come here about 2 times in the past two months, because it's my boss's favorite place near work. I have to say, I was not disappointed in the least! The first time we went, I had the Crab Ravioli in Salsa Rosa, and it was absolutely wonderful. The second time, I had Cheese and Spinach Ravioli in a olive oil and parmiggiano dressing. As you can tell, I'm a softy when it comes to Ravioli... Both dishes were so simple yet so satisfying! We ended both meals with a homemade Tiramisu (my favorite) and a shot of espresso!

Mille Grazie for the great service and even better food!
author: Maria Francesca A.

description: Solid place excellent ingredients. Price point is about average with the surrounding area but highlight is the comfortable atmosphere. Not pretentious, doesn't try to impress people with fancy food, food is simply made and delicious. Had beef lasagna and margarita pizza. Super fresh.
author: Raymond F.

description: I ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo to-go and waited outside for 15-20 minutes which was understandable since it was very packed and busy. The fettuccine was perfectly cooked with the right amount of white sauce and chicken. They also gave me bread on the side but it was too hard to chew. Reasonable price and one of the employee ran to give me my order since he saw me walking away. I would return to this place again.
author: Kathy D.

description:
What a great authentic Italian food! 
I went to sushi restaurant next to this place and walked in to get a coffee. They had a really good pizza and roast pork. The owner was working in kitchen and they make their own bread too. Even coffee was delicious! !!!
author: Jiyoung L.

description: Spectacular local Italian restaurant.  Informal, very personable and sauces to die for!
author: john w.

description: Visiting SF on business and dining alone. Wanted a place casual enough that a solo diner would not feel out of place but with good food. Found this place on Yelp. It was exactly what I was looking for. The place is small with about half bistro tables and half bar-height tables. Atmosphere is casual bistro - you might almost mistake it for one of those fast-casual chains where you order at the counter, but it's not and the service was excellent. The staff all speak to each other in Italian so you almost feel like you've stepped into Italy. Even the young couple sitting next to me were Italian so I figured it must be good! The waiter brought out a partial loaf of delicious bread, crusty outside and flaky inside, with a large bowl of olive oil for dipping, and a bottle of (tap) water. My Greek salad was delicious and my penne all'arrabiata was perfectly al dente and pleasantly spicy. Tira misu was just right. And the prices were very reasonable - especially for SF. Only giving 4 stars because I didn't think the pizzas looked very good which is half the menu, and because the waiter neither offered me fresh pepper for my salad nor Parmesan for my pasta. But overall it was an excellent meal and I'd definitely go back again.
author: Joe S.

description: Great place, real Italian food. Got the Classic Calzone, was just plain Italian goodness. Waiters are really kind and precise about your order to get it just the way you want. Highly recommended.
author: gabriella c.

description:
Fresh and delicious !!
Artichoke ravioli is one of a kind, egg pizza was a fresh take
Very recommended !!
author: Liron L.

description:
I see people poke their head in and keep on walking and I want to tell them "hey, hey, stop, this is the best spot you'll find" but I'm always too busy stuffing my face with pizza - this is the kinda place where I order pizza and then pasta. Carbo load but this place makes it worth it. So the food is great but so is the owner who makes it a habit to say hello and welcome you. I don't know of any other restaurants like that, do you? If so I want to hear about them, that's where I want to be putting my money.

On to what to eat. I start with a slice of the vegetarian pizza and then do the butternut squash ravioli - it's literally the best I've ever had. I'm a meat lover but I go veg when I come here. My boyfriend always orders the puttanesca which is also so good.
author: Reyna F.

description:
Another low key but super reliable local establishment. In the sea of so-called Italian restaurants along Columbus, Piccolo Forno has proved itself not to be a tourist trap but with awesome home styled delish dishes.

The atmosphere's like a modern bistro but without crazy prices. 

And when you're there, say hello to Giuseppe. He always recognizes the locals and offers interesting dishes. I'm glad they're in the neighborhood and redefining "Italian" in North Beach.
author: May W.

description:
Piccolo Forno is a gem Giuseppe and his staff are hard working people always with a smile and ready to joke 
Food is excellent I love them!
author: Elisabetta A.

description:
*Excellent Service, Excellent Food, Great Location in North Beach*

I found it on yelp...5 stars and 32 reviews...they have only been open for 7 weeks!  The hubby and I ventured out and it was so worth it!

ORDERED:
Margarita pizza
Mushroom and beef gnocchi
Beef Lasagna
Raspberry italian sodas

The the lasagna was so good we were playing tug-of-war with it.

The servers were sweet, responsive, patient.  I felt like family a little bit!

Definitely worth a shot if you're in town.
author: Rimi K.

description: It's little Italy - the ambiance, and the owners; super auhentic. Excellent pasta. You get wine from the store next door. Tortellini, Gnocchi, and Artichoke Ravioli are all excellent dishes. Special shootout for Artichoke Ravioli.
author: Sai M.

description: Went after seeing the Summer of Love exhibit and it was just perfect. The owner is charming and funny and his food is fantastic. My husband and I enjoyed pasta, salad and dessert and our bill was incredibly reasonable for the quality. We live in Napa and would venture again to the City just to eat here again.
author: Emilia C.

description: Solid spot. My spaghetti and meatballs was seriously on point. It has a casual type of feel to it but they are sweet and the food speaks for itself.
author: Rouz E.

description:
My husband accidentally found this place when we were walking through North Beach on our weekend urban hike.  

The restaurant was new, clean and modern, yet cozy.  The kind and friendly waitress named Julieta greeted and seated us at one of the high tables.  She immediately told us about the pasta of the day, which sounded all delicious.  

We started off with the Greek salad (romaine lettuce, feta cheese, red onions, tomatoes tossed in olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette).   This was super tasty and fresh! 

My husband got the margherita pizza that was freshly made out of the oven.  The pie was thin and perfectly crispy.  It was simple, but good flavor.  

I had the spaghetti with meat sauce. The pasta was cooked al dente.  The flavors were well-marinated and it kept well when I finished the other half to eat at home.  The portion was pretty generous.  

Overall, this is a great place to sit down and enjoy a good meal without waiting for 2+ hours for the other well-known Italian restaurants.  The prices were very reasonably too, which is always a plus!  

A quick shout out to our adorable waitress, Julieta, she was attentive, kind, caring, and took care of us well.  If you read this, we loved your Argentian accent!  (Can you read a book next time we visit)?  

We will definitely come back soon!  Cheers and XO.
author: Deborah C.

description: Cosy local restaurant . Friendly and fast service . Food was great . We ordered Pizza and Pasta both very delicious and homemade style . Highly recommended.
author: payam b.

description: Pizzas are really good and the service was very welcoming and warm. I had a great dinner and I will come back for sure.
author: Monika B.

description: Nice owner (I assume) but meh food. Worst Caesar salad ever plated. Antipasto had no flavor at all. My son liked his sausage pizza and my lasagna had a good flavor. I can't imagine a city like San Francisco would allow such an establishment to flourish in a town with such stellar Italian food. Someone is asleep at the wheel. I honestly feel bad leaving this review because the owner or manager was so nice but the food needs work.
author: David L.

description:
Haven't been to any other spot in SF that does thin crust the same way. Super thin, Crispy on the bottom and cheese melty on top.  

Just how it should be done, pasta, pizza and espresso in the same sitting. 

The small team that works at Piccolo Forno could not have been more welcoming. They obviously care how everything is tasting and how our experience was shaking out- Has the warmth of a friendly neighborhood corner and the heartiness of a family dinner all in a modern shop. 

Will take all my pizza lovers here.
author: Gabrielle S.

description: Wonderful spot! Just stopped in on a whim as I was heading back to my hotel. I ordered some pizza and ceasar salad w/chicken as take away. Great service and concern to be sure I was happy with what I ordered! Thank you guys!
author: Barry M.

description: Excellent food. We ordered chicken alfredo and a pesto pasta special. Yum. Near perfect service.  Highly recommend.
author: Chelsea M.

description: Stopped by for a quick bite and it was amazing! Definitely recommend, prices are great and service is wonderful.
author: Vivian G.

description: The staff is rude, but the food wakes your senses up!  I'm truly amazed by the pizza and gnocchi.
author: Avinash R.

description:
Wow! This little restaurant is authentic, delicious and fresh. Everyone (including the kids) loved it! 

My family's reviews: the pasta with spicy red sauce was amazing and the Pizza Margherita was excellent. The owner was incredibly kind and accommodating with my dietary restrictions: he created an amazing dish that avoided things I can't eat (which says a lot, considering I am a gluten and dairy free customer eating Italian food). The result was divine: gluten-free Fettuccine with mildly spicy olive oil, garlic, spinach and herbs. Yum. 

We will be back.
author: Laura N.

description: Came here with a bottle of wine, left with a full heart and stomach. Giussepe, the owner, was super friendly and the food was top notch. Great prices, great flavors and great times. Looking forward to my next time back :)
author: Mike J.

description: BYOW - bring your own wine! The restaurant doesn't serve wine or beer but you can bring some in. We split the spinach and cheese ravioli with beef ragu and the calzone with ricotta and some kind of meat (I forget -- too many beers at the Giants game earlier). Both were so good. The calzone was a surprise hit for sure, and they serve it with spicy olive oil. YUMMMMM. Come here hungry and leave feeling full plus slightly drunk. Win-win in my book.
author: Caitlin G.

description: They've brought real Italy to us!  Lovely lunch, never rushed, Owner rocks and the special of the day "Halibut on Eggplant" was amazing! 2 of us shared that & the anti pasta platter that Owner let us select what we wanted. And so comfortable there that 12 noon luncheon & fun chatting ended at 3pm! I wish they had a beer/wine license but hopefully someday they will (City moratorium) but he said we can bring our own for a minimal corkage. My Genovese self is going back soon with my Vino for dinner and back for a great lunch. It was like being in Italy without jetlag
author: Judi B.

description: This food here is vary authentic and feels like Italy.  Excellent service and fine quality ingredients. If requested they can make your pizza cracker thin.  Try it!
author: steve o.

description: Great food! Only four stars because the dishes are a little small (I understand they make everything by hand and it takes forever, plus Americans are used to huge portions, but still disappointing). The food was amazing!!! They don't have a alcohol license, but you can buy wine next store and they don't have a corking fee! The squash and artichoke ravioli were so good!
author: Meghan H.

description: First customers there, Great service. Very friendly as soon as you walk in. Feels like a legit little taste of Italy. Definitely would come back again! We also got some ice cream on the house which was also amazing!
author: Layla D.

description:
We found this place by accident and so glad that we did!! Had such an amazing dinner!! 

The restaurant is small and very cozy, and the staff is extremely friendly. The staff makes you feel very welcome and like family. We were immediately greeted and seated. We started off with 2 Italian sodas (ginger beer, chinotto). After much debating we decided on the house specials (gnocchi and carbonara) and ordered a side of warm foccacia bread. Our dinner came out fast, and hot and oh my it was DELICIOUS!! So fresh and light, pasta was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection. The gnocchi was light, fluffy and melted in your mouth. We just about licked our plate clean.

We were so stuffed, but since dinner had been so good we had to get dessert. Our waitress recommended hazelnut coffee cake (tasted just like the Ferraro rocher chocolates) it was amazing and the lemon gelato was light and creamy. 

Looking forward to coming back and trying the pizzas!!
author: Annelise G.

description: If you're looking for authentic Italian food, this is a must. Food is great, service is great. I eat here every week more then once!!
author: Jimmy M.

description: There are few Italian restaurants that know how to make home-cooked, authentic Italian food. This is one of them, and it's fantastic. The Italian owner and chef is friendly and makes fresh pasta and pizza that's some of the best I've ever had. Highly recommended.
author: Eric G.

description: Great food and freshly made! The 1st guy wasn't so pleasant and friendly but when the owner got there, he was definitely the light of party. Very social, welcoming and just seemed to be very outgoing. The calzone was ENORMOUS, i literally cut it into 1/4 & fed my family of 4. The parmesan cheese was freshly grated and the & pizza was yummy! My FAVORITE thing and most flavorful thing were the raviolis by far. Good, fresh, Italian food.
author: Deanna D.

description: Everything we tried here was delicious. We tried the lasagna, the gnocchi, tortellini, and pizza.  It was like being back in Italy.  The marinara and bolognese sauces are perfection!
author: Mauri S.

description:
A terrific little Italian restaurant. All the dough is made fresh, the sauces are terrific, the pasta has the right texture,  the bread is incredible. Just amazing well executed food at a great value by SF standards. A definite recommendation to anyone visiting the North Beach area. 

Hard to beat
author: Ajit K.

description: I can't say enough about this place! We brought our whole bridal party here the night before our wedding and it was one of the best decisions we made. Everyone raved about the delicious food, amazing service, and wonderful ambiance! Giuseppe was so great to work with, he helped us accomplish exactly what we wanted for our casual rehearsal dinner. It was casual but still very authentic and so much fun. This will be our new go-to restaurant in SF!
author: Kimia S.

description: Amazing Italian. Having lived in Italy and Brooklyn, being raised in an Italian family in the food business, I usually hate Italian food in America. But this place is AMAZING. Fresh. Authentic. Cuts no corners. We got the arugula salad-incredible. Pizza: half anchovies and half tuna-delicious. Made fresh. Crust was crisp but not too thin. Perfect amount of toppings. Dessert: profiteroles-perfect! I will be coming back. Owner came straight from almafi coast, so sweet and genuine.
author: Xena F.

description: I'm from Chicago and in my opinion, the food here is really not good.  We had a margarita pizza which was mediocre at best.  The alfredo had limp noodles that were more like an egg noodles than fettuccine, flavorless sauce and barely any chicken, and the lasagna was soupy.  I don't recommend.
author: Julie B.

description: Walking back to our hotel and we smelled Pizza!  Yelpers gave this place a good review. Simple local and clean. We each had a slice ( mine with the thinly sliced pepperoni and my wife had a plain slice with cheese.  The slices are square but amble and good tasting. Unfortunately not like New York style but this was like the type we had when visiting Italy. They gave us warm bread with Italian Olive oil..  My wife ordered a house salad and large enough to share and the vinaigrette dressing was light and delicious.  The owner told us we could buy wine next door and enjoy it in his place without a cork fee. Soft Italian music in the background   Saw Stromboli there too. I would recommend this place for local pizza
author: Louis A.

description: Best pizzeria in SF, Excellent Artichoke Ravioli! Sauces are amazing. The staff seams to be all from Italy, and it shows.
author: Jason A.

description:
Excellent pasta and pizza. Very good food and good value - recommended. Amazing sauces, cozy atmosphere. all perfectly executed.
AMAZING!!!!
author: Thomas R.

description: Fresh Pasta, delicious sauces, and excellent service! The place is modern and clean and you will definitely leave feeling satisfied! If you're craving some fresh Italian food, I highly recommend this spot!
author: Ethan J.

description: Came here to get a quick bite. We ate 3 slices, all delicious. The owner was super friendly as well.  Very pleasant!
author: Denise M.

description: Super delicious and great service! Best pasta sauce I've ever had. Also, high quality olive oil and Parmesan!
author: Grace W.

description: I went to Piccolo Forno with a group of 6. No beer or wine, but you can bring your own with no corkage. I ordered the salsicce and mushroom pizza. It was one of the worst pizzas I have ever eaten. The sausage had no taste exploding in my mouth when I bit into it and the cheese congealed and was hard. The crust tasted like cardboard. They also cut the pizza before serving it to me which I hate. Yes, I ate the pizza because I was hungry, but I didn't like it. When the bill came, we figured it came to $26.00 per person with tip. Three of us paid by credit cards and asked to be charged $26.00. They brought it back with a charge of $27 something. We asked why and they said something like they had to put down what we ordered, bla bla. They are all very nice and it's a lively place, but I will never go back.
author: Tom T.

description:
this place is solid. Some highlights:
- really nice/new/clean space. Great place for a casual lunch or even dinner.
- I had the spaghetti/meatballs. It was very good. Good portion. I finished everything. 
- I've had the pizza here too. A slice of square mushroom, sausage. I didnt think it was very memorable. I thought it needed more sauce and I wish they had left it in the pizza oven for a bit longer to crisp up and melt the cheese. 

I can't help but to compare Piccolo Forno to Italian Homemade which is just across the street. Italian Homemade makes their own noodles in shop which is a huge difference to me. I think Piccolo Forno uses regular store bought dry noodles. The meatballs at Italian Homemade are almost twice as big as well and you really just get the feeling that they put more love into their food. So for me, it's a no brainer to go to Italian Homemade since prices are pretty much comparable.
author: Alex L.

description: I loved the guys who worked here..the pizza was very thin and delicious. The pasta was light and the pomodoro sauce was excellent.
author: Victoria D.

description: The Pizza is great in taste and freshness. The cheese tastes so good just like in Italy.
author: N Y.

description:
The food is delicious!!!
They have a great service and the place is nice. We love the pizza, pasta and Salads!
author: Suelem A.

description: This is my wife and my favorite Italian in North Beach.  We live around the corner and come back all the time for whatever is on their specials list and just let the owner, Guiseppe tell us what is the best that day!  It has been such a great addition to their neighborhood.  Can't go wrong with any of the homemade pastas!
author: Cameron A.

description: Coming to Piccolo Forno makes you feel as if your own family is running the place. And their dishes are superb!
author: Angela B.

description: Small but absolutely authentic Italian restaurant - we tried multiple entrees in order to share and everything was fantastic.  Stop by the corner wine shop and bring your own wine.  Great restaurant.
author: Brian M.

description: Always great place to stop by for pizza! This is a really authentic italian restaurant. The service is great and everyone really goes out of their way to take care of you.
author: Michelle T.

description:
It would be hard to beat this place.  This is true Italian.  Perfectly cooked pastas and pizza.  Highly recommend the crab ravioli.  

Wonderful people and ownership.  Giuseppe is the owner and is so friendly and helpful.  This one is a must in San Fran.
author: Kevin W.

description: Amazing pizza and pasta, plus the friendliest service! Highly recommend the burrata, which they have delivered daily from LA. A gem of a place.
author: Hilary H.

description: Great prosciutto and arugula pizza- perfect sauce and crust. Friendly service. So glad we stopped in.
author: Greg M.

description: I can honestly say this is the pasta I've ever had! We stumbled upon this place while exploring Little Italy and I can't wait to go back. They were able to seat 7 of us right away, although it is a smaller space the food makes it worth it. People in our party wanted lasagna and they had just ran out, so the owner said we could wait 30 minutes and he would bring out fresh made lasagna. This lasagna was absolutely amazing! I personally order the cheese tortellini and I loved it. However, I did try their specials for the day and wished I would have order them for myself. They had a butternut squash ravioli that was to die for. Great flavor and texture! The dish that made my fall in love with this place was their asparagus ravioli with white truffle. I've never tried truffle before and was excited to try it. This ravioli was beautiful, the best I've had. It's hard to describe the flavor but I can't wait to go back and order this! The owner was exceptional, very welcoming, and kind. BEST PASTA!
author: Taylor P.

description:
The best fettuccine we have ever had!  The sauces are amazing & they make their own pasta everyday!!  Lemon sorbet was served in a lemon & just excellent & refreshing!  

We will be back and we are from Dallas & we are foodies!   Thank you!!!
author: Theresa L.

description: Great pizza for a good price. We got the 4 cheese, Margherita and the Bresaola. Highly recommend the Bresaola. Very authentic experience and the staff is really friendly. Bring a bottle of wine (or buy one from the place next door like we did) and they have glasses and will ice the bottle and take care of everything for your free of charge.
author: Lance H.

description:
Piccolo Forno is an excellent Italian restaurant in North Beach.

I ordered the special, a breaded pork medallion and it was superb. The seasoning was tasty and the sauce was elegant. The price was reasonable; I think it was about $16 for the port medallion and vegetables.

The waiter was helpful in making recommendations.

The restaurant is small but that has a nice touch. Piccolo Forno also offers a variety of pizzas in addition to traditional Italian dinners.

 I recommend this place. The only downside is that there is no private parking lot; metered street parking only.
author: Robert H.

description: So good. So cute. Great neighborhood spot and the yelp app pickup situation is on point. Ordered the sausage mushroom and the veggie to-go and both were delightful. May I also say, the best veggie pizza I've ever had. Grilled radicchio for the win!!
author: Emily G.

description: This was the last stop that my wife and I made on our honeymoon.   We had the Greek salad and a pizza with sausage and mushrooms.  Everything was soooooo good.   The pizza was cooked just right and the salad's dressing had a great flavor.   We will definitely come here again when we return to San Fran.
author: Justin S.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in north beach for sure!!! Service is wonderful and every staff member is so friendly. A very welcoming authentic restaurant with a family feel. Marg pizza was so great, gnocchi was to die for, and buratta was perfect. We were ready to leave and owner told us to sit back down and brought us dessert on the house!! Now that's great service!!! Highly recommend this place!
author: Evelyn A.

description: Excellent pizza and pasta. Great neighborhood atmosphere. Pizza crispy on bottom and yummy on top. Pasta and wife's special requests were accepted with a smile
author: Stan K.

description: Excellent food. Fantastic service with a smile. The marinara sauce was phenomenal.  The calzones were amazing. Only negative was it got an it warm in the resturant. We had a group of 9 and everyone was very happy and really enjoyed their food and the experience.
author: Scott R.

description:
Whoa! This pizza is superb. The rich, chewy, crispy crust. Some of the best I've ever had! And I would call myself a pizza connoisseur. The toppings, the prices were perfect. I also ordered some of the roasted veggies they had and they were excellent. 
No wine or alcohol served here, but the pizza made up for it. Not the fastest service, as it was just one guy waiting on every table, but he was pulling it off ok I suppose.
I'd eat here all the time if I lived in the area!
Recommend!!!!
author: Sharon B.

description:
The food here is so good, I could cry of joy. We had little pizza squares and shared a tortelloni with a tomato/meat sauce that competes with my nonna's. 

The coffee afterwards was delicious and I now have a better alternative to the standard North Beach coffee.

Next time, I'm trying the traditional pizza and dessert.

We're coming back every week from now on!
author: Shelley C.

description: Excellent service and food! The staff was very friendly and attentive. If you are in a hurry or starving, they have pizzas premade in a glass case in the front. We ordered a few slices for our kids upfront, which were okay. We then ordered a pizza with caramelized onions/tuna and spaghetti with marinara, which were absolutely delicious. The marinara is so fresh and tasty - we did not let one drop go to waste by soaking it all up with our bread/pizza crust!
author: Shauna P.

description: Yesterday I had the best sandwich in my life her at this restaurant. 6 hours of roasted pork on focaccia bread with roasted romaine lettuce and dip it in there olive oil. Both my kids loved their meal, spaghetti and meatballs and lasagna. Everyone at the table kept dipping their bread into my sons sauce.
author: Jade E.

description: I order their crab ravioli and was delicious!!! Very light and flavorful, a prefect combo! Our server was very friendly and funny! My family and friends ordered their margarita pizza and spaghetti & meatball and they said it was delicious as well! Highly recommend.
author: Carman C.

description:
All around fantastic. My husband and I went here after a long day traveling in and we were driving looking for parking and figure we find a place after we parked. Luckily we didn't have to walk far in the pouring rain. This place was friendly, delicious and clean my top three musts. I tend to only do reviews on here when. Place really has the wow factor or have given the three strikes and this place has the wow factor. 
It was very clean and has a modern feel as look. The server was very knowledgable and beyond friendly. After the most delicious appetizer of zucchini slice of pizza and the penne with eggplant and fresh basil which was mouth watering I can still taste it mmmm. I was just right not over full but not enough room for my own desert. I did want the pistachio gelato but my husband ordered a delicious berry layered pastry. And the server heard me say I wanted gelato but knew I couldn't finish so he added a scoop. It was the perfect ending to an amazing dining experience. 
FOOD: they have an open pizza slice selection we chose to try two different ones for our apps yes we were hungry lol. I had the zucchini and was mouth watering the cheese was perfect so flavorful and the sliced zucchini was a great touch as opposed to the diced like most other places. Crispy thin crust. Then our meals. I had the penne eggplant marinara it was perfect amount for the dish not over the top amounts. It was a flavorful mix of tomato, fresh slices basil with chunks of eggplant that melted in your mouth with so much flavor. There was a perfect amount of mozzarella cheese to not overpower the dish with cheese flavor. My husband had the chicken Alfredo which was a light dish packed with a lot of flavor with its simplicity.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Seriously can't wait to come again we ordered the affogato espressos it has ice cream in  a strong expresso so delicious and creamy. Tiramisu it was thick creamy delicious.
Service is great friendly staff informed and let you know what's on the menu.
I order today special which has crab raviolis you get about 6 of them for about 16 bucks worth it great flavor you can taste crab and each ravioli.
Hubby ordered the Pizza Capriccioso. Thin crust pizza with Kalamata olives, artichoke, mushrooms, prosciutto, and  cheese and the middle they have a over easy egg absolutely delicious and savory.
Also very important when you're walking around San Francisco to have a nice clean bathroom open on to customers.
author: Nona W.

description: Piccolo Forno is a new Italian spot in North Beach, essentially the Italian food central of San Francisco. They have a selection of pre-made pizzas, sandwiches, and cold dishes on display, but I'd recommend you try their menu items that are made to order. My boyfriend and I tried their margherita pizza, which I loved. The crust was just right, thin but with a doughy crust. The slightly sweet tomato sauce was a great contrast to the light mozzarella and generous basil. We also tried the spaghetti carbonara, which tasted authentic yet relatively light. The noodles were perfectly al dente as well. Although I was satisfied with all the food, it was still difficult to live up to Italian Homemade, located right across the street. But it's definitely a place I'd go to satisfy a pizza craving!
author: Ashley T.

description:
I'll start by saying that the food is actually quite tasty and the servers are friendly. The major problem is the portion size. I ordered the $14 lasagna to go, and it was TINY. I'm a small guy and not a big eater, but I had to go buy a sandwich after my lasagna because it was essentially 4 bites of food. For a $15 including tax, you expect a little more than a few bites of tomato sauce.

I wanted to like this place, but I just can't recommend it.
author: David T.

description: My friends and I came here for dinner after a long day and absolutely loved it! We brought bottles of wine with us and were so excited that it was BYOB (we had good wine with us). The service was great. The food was great. We had a really nice night and I'm so thankful we wound up there. If I could've changed anything, I would've turned up the volume of the music up to set the tone a little more - but overall, fantastic night out! As a local, I'll definitely be back and spread the word :)
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
The people behind our neighborhood favorite Ideale have come up with a winner on what was once a forgotten stretch of Columbus Avenue in North Beach. If you are looking for unique and delicious Italian fare at reasonable prices this is the new place to be...

I've eaten here now on a number of occasions and have yet to be disappointed. From classic Italian meatloaf complete with hard-boiled egg in the center, to pasta, to a savory pie with veal, to Roman thin-crust pizza - everything is simple, hearty, and makes you feel like someone's mom or grandmother is back in the kitchen throwing the food together with ingredients fresh from her garden. You'll know that's not the case when you're here, however, as you'll see Giuseppe and the crew back in the open kitchen pouring love into everything that's prepared...

They make different items daily visible 'under the glass' when you go in, but be sure to look at the menu too otherwise you'll miss the pastas. Their uniqueness comes from the variety and nature of the fresh daily items, all of which can be taken out for lunch at the office or an easy dinner at home too. But eat at the restaurant if you can, you won't find a friendlier environment in the area.

Great, clean, fresh food from people who know good food, served with a little bit of Italy and a smile. Two big thumbs up...
author: Arthur S.

description: Always a great authentic Italian meal here. Pizza is fantastic and pasta as well. We always get the Meatballs and pasta and a pizza. Daily antipasto are authentic and delicious. Desserts are awesome too. Owner operated in the middle of North beach. Great for families but needs a few more high chairs.
author: Charlie O.

description: Very good pizza and pasta. The meat lasagna was delicious and the mushroom and sausage pizza also. Service was very good. Prices were excellent for what you got. Clean restaurant. Owner and patrons speaking in Italian. Very impressed.
author: Kristie L.

description:
Loved the ravioli and Mysta salad. The Caprioso pizza was interesting and better the next day. The ambience and friendly staff was great as well.  3 stars because the bread was burnt. It was quickly replaced but still slightly charred.
  Especially enjoyed the stark modernity of the decor and striking paintings on the walls.
  Moderate prices. Will return to explore the menu.
author: E W.

description: Perfect. We had the 4 cheese ravioli and it was wonderful. The couples with us had delicious pizza.  One said it was salty. We brought in our own wine, they don't have drinks. Great service and they seem to take pride in the place.
author: Kathy L.

description: Authentic Italian cuisine and service in North Beach!  We love this place!  The antipasti, salads, pizzas and pastas are excellent, very warm and welcoming atmosphere, very laid back, Guiseppe the owner recently came to SF from Italy, really cares about the quality of the food, and warmly greets his guests.  Great value price-wise!  They are still waiting for their liquor license, so just bring a bottle of wine and they will open and provide glasses-- no corkage charge!  You will feel you are in Italy!  Come and experience genuine Italian food and hospitality !  Buon appetito!
author: Anne C.

description: I love love loved this place! Great atmosphere, Amazing food at a reasonable price. We had the crab ravioli, an Ideale pizza and a Monte Bianco pizza, everything was delicious. If you're ever in the area, stop by, you will not be disappointed!
author: S H.

description:
The ingredients are fresh and seasonal.  The service was great.  They even opened the door for incoming customers. You can see what they are making in the kitchen. We saw a patron local SFPD officer resembling a comic book caricature, wearing a 7-point cap and carrying a wooden nightstick and thought he got confused since it used to be a donut shop.

It is great to see young Italian restaurateurs bringing cuisine back into North Beach, which at a previous time became an exodus for the district. The place feels authentic, so much so that the waitress from Capri is still learning English. The ambiance feels hip but their food still holds true to Italian cooking -- lots of amore and freshness put into it.  We had the vegetariano calzone, bull mozzarella arugula salad, and ham lasagna and liked them all.  Will try the tiramisu for desert next time.
author: Vic C.

description:
Great food and friendly service. We had a nice lunch of salad, pizza , pasta, dessert, and espresso drink all for about fifty bucks. What an awesome deal! The pizza was thin and crisp, the way I love it.

Best meal I've had in a while and so glad this place opened up. Strange how empty it was but I'm sure this will quickly change once people catch on to this new gem in north beach!
author: Jeanne C.

description: What an awesome Italian restaurant. Only about a 10 minute walk from Fishermans Wharf, this small restaurant is kid friendly and delicious. Everything has that homemade flavor that makes you want to try more. Treat yourself to some amazing pesto and room for dessert.
author: Josh M.

description: So so good! So easy to end up at a mediocre restaurant in North Beach that finding this place was a real treat. Original and delicioso and very friendly and welcoming staff.
author: Alison S.

description: Delicious and so friendly! The staff was amazing accommodating our large group. We also have various allergies and they did their absolute best to accommodate. Would absolutely come over and over again.
author: Amilia B.

description: Best gnocchi sorrentina  I've ever had!!! The Homemade tiramisu was DELICIOUS!! My parents were impressed with the pizza too. We will be back. Thanks Piccolo Forno.
author: Kenneth B.

description: Love this place, the food is always delicious, I recommend you always try the specials, very authentic Italian food, very reasonable prices!!!!
author: Kevin T.

description:
I was new in town and had friends visiting. "Surely," I thought, "Surely we can get a table around here somewhere." Even though there are about 11 Italian restaurants per block, most places had an hours-long waiting list. Some even laughed in our faces for asking, so we had that going for us. 

Not Piccolo Forno. We walked in to a friendly greeting, an open table, and a pizza display to refresh a tired soul. It seemed like hardly any time passed between ordering food and food appearing. My spaghetti was perfectly al dente and the sprinkle of fresh basil on the meatballs made my whole day worthwhile. One of my friends got the piccolo forno pizza. He is now seriously considering moving to San Francisco. 

A week later, when my family was visiting, we went back. We received the same warm greeting, and the owner quickly rearranged tables so we could all sit together and without getting a cold blast of air from the door opening. My dad and I split a salad and fought over the last tomato. I don't even like raw tomatoes. My sister-in-law and I got spaghetti carbonara. I now realize that up to Wednesday night, I'd only ever eaten "carbonara," not carbonara. 

TL;DR: kind people, amazing and authentic food, not crowded.

I'm going to be pretty sad when everyone finds out about this place and I can't sneak in there with no reservation on a Saturday night anymore.
author: Allison P.

description: Awesome service, quality and value.  Pizza and eggplant penne was perfect.  Got there just before closing and they accommodated us well.  Worth the five stars.
author: Warren S.

description: Fantastic food and service!   The meat sauce for the lasagna was AMAZING!   The calzone is big enough for 2 people and the staff was so nice.  The guys there love cooking and it is very evident.
author: Shana P.

description: Amazing place and the service was kind and genuine. True Italian. We ordered whatever was suggested! We wish we could go here every night for fresh authentic Italian food!
author: Shannon L.

description: We found this restaurant by chance while visiting San Francisco and we want to make sure you find your way there as well. The food is amazing and the service exceptional, you can enjoy fresh pasta, freshly made bread, delicious tiramisu... and lots more. Loved it and definitely coming back :)
author: Andrea T.

description: My brother, sister-in-law, and I had just a bit of time to hang out in North Beach on a rainy Monday afternoon. We discovered "sunshine" and delicious authentic Italian food at this fun, little cafe. The staff was very welcoming, attentive, sweet, and eager to make sure we enjoyed our meal. My lasagna and (three flavors of) gelato were so delicious. (See my clean plate!) I'm definitely going back for more! Oh, and they have fun "Shazamable" Italian music. Check it out!
author: Sharon M.

description: Authentic Italian food! Friendly service from Giuseppe the owner. My sister and I were walking by and noticed his new place. The pizza and spinach ricotta pie looked so delicious it stopped us in our tracks even though we just ate. We ordered pizza and the pie to go and heated it up for dinner per his instructions. Mmmmmmm the ricotta was exceptional and the pizza yummy with flavor!!! Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Cecilia D.

description: Ultra impressed. The pizza was perfect (assuming you're into woodfired pizza). We had the "Ideale", and I was very impressed. And that's just the food. As we walked in, the owner walked in with us as he discussed why might be was good, set our table, and made us feel like he was our oldest friend.  This restaurant embodies the North Beach experience, not with ambiance, but with character and flavor.
author: Michael F.

description:
One of the few really Italian places in North Beach, and I'm Italian so I can tell!!!
Everything is great, from the pizza slices to the pasta!!
Try the sorbetto as well! Is really fresh and juicy and is served in a lemon!! 
The owner Giuseppe is so friendly and helpful! 
I love this place!
author: Anastasia B.

description:
In my last review, I had to share some tough love about pizza that was just plain bad, but I truly hope they visit Piccolo Forno to see how it should be done. 

[http://www.yelp.com/biz/san-drino-sausalito-2?hrid=dlx5Df8FGisQs7pRd62KWw&utm_campaign=www_review_share_popup&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=(direct)]

Tonight my wife and I were delighted wander in on Piccolo Forno's very first night in business! They are expecting a very big forno shortly so I wondered if the name was in reference to the tiny warming oven behind the counter, perhaps a sentimental possession that got the whole thing going, or just a nod to the restaurant's cute size.

These guys, Simone & Giuseppe, were friends from IDEALE, another great restaurant, and just opened up this new venture. I overheard Giuseppe say that they kitted out the interior themselves which is modern and hip. The low volume, old school Italian pop playing in the background made the scene.

As for the food, they haven't even gotten their pizza oven and these guys are already rocking great pies. It is quite clear they really know what they are doing and are very good at it. Giuseppe talked with passion about getting the temperature just right for pizza crust. Now this is a guy I can respect. My wife's pasta was also delicious as was the Torta Caprese that we finished the evening with.

I am not the kind of guy that fawns over great service, but the service was distinctly friendly with a nice local feel which I hope they can maintain when they get as wildly popular as I think they will be.

Oddly with the The Italian Homemade Company across the street, North Beach is moving closer to our house! Piccolo Forno replaces a sad place called Tasty Bites that was not too tasty but did bite. Their doom was clearly near when virtually the entire front window was plastered with offers of an overblown and far too diverse menu. Piccolo Forno is a welcome addition to the neighborhood. Nice work gents. You are off to a great start!
author: Ken P.

description: Just stopping by to express my love and approval for the spaghetti and meatballs.
author: Janett R.

description: Great service, although we had to wait a very long time for a table (no reservations taken, so you have to stand around if it's busy) the staff definitely worked hard to make up for it when we got seated. Pizza was good, and the sorbet inside an orange was really good too
author: Alex M.

description:
Very happy we came across this hidden gem! We will be back. All good was homemade, fresh and authentic. 

Even the locals frequent this restaurant.
author: Mark A.

description:
Wow, the food is great here. This newly opened casual restaurant reminds me of a pizza cafe in Rome. There are slabs of pizza, bowls of marinated vegetables, and a case of homemade desserts. It's like walking into an Italian kitchen. 

Everything was affordable. Pizza is $4.50 for a large slice and $10-14 for homemade pasta and sauces. Menu changes daily so it's pretty exciting to go in and see what they made for the day. 

It's relatively quiet now since it's so new but I think this place will be packed pretty soon because it's high quality food and affordable prices.
author: Charles L.

description: 1st time here and the food was awesome, i ordered pizza al funghi, penna All'arrabiata and spaghetti Meatballs everything was just perfect. people working here are very nice and friendly. I will definitely come back here for this amazing food and hospitality
author: Fatma I.

description: The food was fabulous. The service was excellent and the price was very reasonable. We will certainly be back.
author: Dowdy J.

description: Italian food is something that is prized. PF is one of the best experiences you can have in the city. From the moment the food touches your mouth to the moment you realize how perfect the experience is, is something that you will never regret. BYOB for an outstanding job is why myself and our friends always come to this hidden gem!
author: Jeff W.

description: So good ! Amazing customer service and even more amazing pizza & pasta ! Definitely a treat
author: Stacey H.

description:
I am absolutely enamored by the fact that restaurants like these are sprouting up along Columbus with each passing year. It makes me appreciate rent control more and more in one of the best neighborhoods in SF.

The first things you notice upon entering is the clean no-frills interior and a booming/hearty welcome from the staff. You want Italian? Well, the owner's friendliness, accent, and concern for your overall enjoyment of the meal makes you feel like you're at a sit-down meal with the family. Just ask him to recommend things off the menu and subsequently listen to him rattle off 12 things and then say everything's tasty!

Overall, the food quality was pretty good, portions were a bit small and plating was messy...kinda like how you would serve yourself at home. Rather than critique using my subjective preferences (i.e. Carbonara was runnier than expected, pizza was doughy/a little dry, etc.), I will say that I had an extremely pleasant experience.
author: Nick W.

description: The ravioli was delicious! Pizza outstanding! You can bring in your own alcohol....best place in little Italy!
author: Catherine M.

description: Great service and delicious food!!! I'll make sure to be back on my next trip to this City.
author: Daniel P.

description: The best pizza . With good pasta really Italians place . Try . Good service with Giuseppe. Thanks piccolo forno
author: Aey S.

description:
1- This place praises itself for it's oven by naming itself as a bakery (Forno=Oven). Yet the bread was served cold.
2- We had a pizza ideale & an arugula burrata salad. The arugula wasn't dressed. 
3- The pizza had a rotten cherry tomato on it, I told them they said they get their produce fresh on daily basis.
4- The waiter walked out of the restaurant & spat out on the sidewalk where we could see him. 

I wasn't feeling well after eating here.

Overall this place felt like a tourist trap. We live in SF, we always go to The homemade italian pasta company, but mistakingly gave this place a try.

Hope they improve.
author: Evelyn Z.

description: The crab ravioli was the best I've ever had. The owner was personable and kind. The location is great. I'll definitely be back!
author: Gerold D.

description: My husband and I had lunch here. Great atmosphere, great service. Crab ravioli was delicious. The veal tortellini with meat sauce was really good too, but the crab was our favorite. I would highly recommend for service and price.
author: Emilie G.

description: This place is perfect! Great pizza, good vibes, friendly staff, great dessert! We will definitely be back.
author: Charleen L.

description:
Loved the casual, friendly atmosphere.
I had the Insalata Caprese, the Ravioli ai Carciofi and a cappucino. Food was fresh and flavors were great, though my ravioli was not hot.

But the main reason I'm writing the review -- I had to use the restroom.  The walk through the kitchen to get to was kind of cool, but then the bathroom wreaked horribly of urine. Can't even express how disgusting that was. It nearly ruined the whole experience.
author: Angela C.

description: Food was really good here. Service was also exceptional. We had a party of 11 and they were very accommodating.
author: Rami W.

description:
TLDR: Service: abysmal, Food: decent. 

I came here Saturday night with a party of 6. I made a reservation ahead of time. There were only two waiters (who also helped cook) and they were clearly overwhelmed. I asked my waiter twice to bring balsamic vinegar for the bread and he forgot both times. He also took our empty water pitchers in the middle of our meal, and instead of refilling them, never brought them back.

We ordered 2 of one type of pasta, and instead of giving us two portions they essentially cooked one serving, and split it in half. The waiter insisted that the large plate made the serving look small, but looking around at other people's plates you could tell that it was half of a portion masquerading as a full one. Kind of a dishonest place. 

I will not come back.
author: Mauri W.

description: I think this is the best casual place in North Beach but the food is often better than what you can find in the more expensive restaurants.  Run by real Italians.  Gnocchi is fabulous and pizza is light and delicious.  Bring your own wine, no corkage fee.
author: Rich A.

description: Loooovvvee this place! Amazing pasta! Delicious pizza! Great salads! Staff is soo nice! Will be back!
author: Angie S.

description: Square slices were a bit too flaky / pastry like for me. Solid atmosphere and other food looks great
author: Jeff L.

description:
Great place! 

While staying in San Fran for work I really wanted some home made pasta. This place makes their own noodles, has fresh food and they have extremely accommodating staff who make the Italian place very authentic. Their owners let us try so many things! Can't beat it!
author: Alexandria V.

description: The food is no better than average. The service is substandard by any measure. I certainly won't be going back. Too many good restaurants in town to choose this one again.
author: Gordon M.

description: We got take out. Ordered online through Yelp. Prompt, friendly, all orders were prepared exactly as ordered. They work hard in that kitchen. Both pizzas, and spaghetti with meatballs were outstanding. Would order or sit in this place to eat again. Everything is fresh and made from scratch. Keep it up.
author: Vinny C.

description: All I can say is: wow. I came in here with high expectations. North Beach has a lot of great pizza places already so opening up another is pretty ballsy.  The toppings are amazing, and the dough! Best pizza dough I have ever had. Perfect Italian flatbread that would be great on its own, but with the sauce and toppings this pizza is too good to miss. I will definitely be back, often.
author: Nelson S.

description: Amazeballs pizza.  Not sure you can find much better anywhere on the planet.  While the don't serve wine, they pointed me down the street to the liquor store and happily corked a bottle for us.  Memorable food, attentive service... Will return with friends.
author: Ed J.

description: Waiter was having trouble communicating in English, food was extremely heavy and greasy, pizza had little flavor, and we waited a very long time to receive our check. Will not be coming back.
author: Najah A.

description: Me and my wife were quite lucky to find this lovely great Italian restaurant on our first day trip in San Francisco. We ordered Pizza and Spaghetti with meatballs everything was extremely delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Ed C.

description:
Excellent service and the food it's just GREAT! Pizza or pasta... Doesn't matter is just delicious! 
Ottimo Giuseppe and company!!!!
author: Beli O.

description:
I wish I could give Piccolo Forno 10/5 stars. Amazing place that is one of my favorite, if not favorite restaurant in the city. Giuseppe, the owner, is one of the most friendly people.

Dishes I have tried:
Spaghetti con Polpette di Manzo (perfectly al dente)
Pennette Piccolo Forno (again, perfectly al dente with delicious pieces of eggplant)
Ravioli ai Carciofi (light pink sauce, delicious)
Specials (Carbonara, spaghetti with clams)

They have a counter full of delicious sides from porchetta (amazing), zucchini, eggplant, spinach - all amazing

Best kept secret in North Beach and a place I will continue to keep going back to.
author: A B.

description:
One of the best place in the city to have your pasta , no need to think, just go there and try the carbonara"! It is really really delicious! 
Thank you guys. you are the best .
author: Victor S.

description:
Welcoming atmosphere, charming staff, and the food was really good.

Freshly made pasta and pizza - we had the pizza diavola and spaghetti carbonara - both are recommended. 

We'll definitely come back here!
author: Maya B.

description: So good!  We wanted a good meal in Little Italy, and this was fantastic!  They have a BYOB policy, but there is a wine store nextdoor that did the trick.  Delicious food and excellent service.  We'll be back!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
This restaurant has delicious food and friendly staff. We had some pizza and pasta. The potato white pizza was uniquely fantastic. The crust is medium thickness with great flavor and crispy on the edges. The chicken fettuccine Alfredo was some of the best we had ever had.
We met the owner and he was so nice to us. We will be back. We need to try dessert next time.
author: Jessica P.

description: Amazing gluten free pizza! The roasted veggies are to die for and the crust is perfect! I cant wait to go back!
author: Michaele K.

description: I really liked the spaghetti and meatballs here! Super simple yet delicious. The meatballs were very flavorful and soft. My boyfriend and I also tried their pizza. It was thin and made to order. Very fresh and I enjoyed eating it! Service is good and it's a cool environment.
author: Catherine L.

description: Owners who also work the front of house are authentic, personable, and very accomodating.  Very good customer service to make your experience great. We went there to order out pizza and while we waited, owner politely provided seating and water (free) and made good conversation.  Watching them do their jobs with others showed good service and attentive to each guests needs.  We got the Margherita pizza and it was really good. Sauce and cheese were high quality and the crust provided the perfect platform for everything to indulge the pizza.
author: Kenton P.

description: Delicious food and excellent service!! Small cozy place, love it I'll definitely come back
author: Luisa Fernanda Z.

description: This was by far one of the best pizzas I have had since my time living in Europe.  Glad I read some of the reviews in advance about bringing your own wine.  Enjoyable evening!
author: Jeff S.

description: First time eating at this restaurant. We had the margherita pizza and the gnocchi.  Both were so delicious!
author: Denyce U.

description: Tried spaghetti, pizza and fettuccine Alfredo. All was delicious. Best meatballs and fettuccine I've had!
author: CC H.

description: Loved the Greek salad! Best feta I've ever had. Fast service once you get a seat. Pizza crust hand tossed good flavor. Sauce is fresh and home maid.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Food was amazing. Fresh bread, gf options, pizza by the slice for our kiddos. Wait staff didn't speak the best English so we didn't get an extra topping we added to our pizza but it was still delicious! Small dining area but took reservations!
author: Jesica G.

description: Best food ever! The staff were very friendly and made you feel like a part of their family. I have never been to another restaurant with such friendly staff. They brought us bread for an appetizer. Just by tasting the bread, I instantly knew that the pizza we ordered was going to be amazing! When it came, it was probably the best pizza I have ever had! The food was fairly expensive, but it was definitely worth it! I barely had room for desert, so I shared it with my family. We got a vanilla gelato. It was amazing! I would highly recommend this place if you want delicious, authentic Italian food! Definitely coming back here next time I'm in the area.
author: Hudson G.

description: Good, tasty and pretty cheap Italian food. Nice service. I would go there again! You should make a reservation though because the place isn't too big and there were people waiting in line...
author: Johanna D.

description: These folks live to provide excellent food and service. Everyone is made to feel like family.
author: Gregg O.

description: A neighborhood favorite. Food is always on point whether delivery or dine in. BYO with no corkage. Reasonable prices and the best staff. Also they have gluten free pizza and pasta!
author: Samantha B.

description: We walked by the night before and it was so busy we had to move on. Ordered dinner tonight through yelp while we were playing at the park across the street so the kids didn't have to wait. When we were ready, we walked up, told them I had an order and it was ready in minutes. Well worth it. Yummy margharita pizza. Amazing cheese tortellini (the sauce!!). And the tirmasu ... delicious. Well worth doubling back after missing out the night before.
author: Micaela S.

description: Loved the atmosphere and personal attention!  My husband and I felt like we were back in Rome at one of the local restaurants there - homemade pasta, great authentic flavor and a cappucino to top it off!  Grazie!!!
author: C D H.

description: Great pizzeria although small place. The staff was super nice and I was very happy to find authentic Italian pizza, and delicious.
author: Carmen S.

description: The food is amazing.   Well worth the walk away from the tourist traps at the pier.   Clean and fantastic food.  Daily specials and custom to order food.   Simply amazing.
author: Dennis C.

description: Always solid food and friendly, personal service.  Pasta and pizza are equally excellent.
author: Adam D.

description: So good! The gnocchi was fluffy, the pasta was al dente and Giuseppe is great, will definitely be back!
author: Caitlin B.

description: Best local Italian place on Columbus! The staff is incredibly genuine and friendly. Definitely recommend!
author: Ryan M.

description: Best pizza value in North Beach! If you're yearning for Italy, this is the place: a small (piccolo) space between Rialto Mercado & Graffeo Coffee which radiates Italian warmth, generosity, & delicious aromas. Giuseppi's meat & cheese pizzas are hearty, & his vegetarian ones are works of art -- frescoes in eggplant, spinach, & mushrooms -- at prices even a North Beach artist can afford. As the menu expands, I may never have to go anywhere else.
author: Charisse H.

description: Friendly staff, relaxed environment and tasty food.  We enjoyed their pasta, but the pizza was so so.  Would come back for their pasta and lasagna's.
author: Jason S.

description:
The Caprice salad was amazing.  Fresh tomatoes, basil, sea salt (i think), capers and the richest extra virgin olive oil.  Also had the Margarita pizza which had a thin crunchy crust.

They do not serve wine but if you'd like to drink, you can bring in a bottle and they will gladly serve it for you.
author: Mike F.

description: Beautiful display of the pizzas, excellent service & clean, urban environment. A must eat. Pizza is delicious!! We knew it was well loved when many local Italians were eating here too.
author: Rachel K.

description: Gluten free spaghetti carbonara was delicious!! Very clean place and the owner is a very nice man and very friendly!! Love that an Italian restaurant has lots of gluten free options, excited to try the pizza next!
author: Melissa T.

description: Great place, the service was great and the food was the best felt like part of the family, it was also very clean. I had the gnocchi... man was that good my wife and baby had marinara spaghetti which also was very good, I've never seen my daughter eat so much. Wonderful experience
author: Chris V.

description:
Extremely slow service, not very good food, and poor quality control (specifically, a piece of TRASH in my Greek salad -- part of the wrapping for the Feta cheese that was in the salad -- and some sort of sludge at the bottom of the iced tea).  

Service was unbelievably slow.  Our party of 4 walked in directly behind another party of 4.  We were all seated at the same time at adjacent tables.  The other table ordered AND RECEIVED their meals before we were even able to order ours. Then our food took so long that the other party finished all of their meals before ours even arrived!  Our orders were not fancy: 2 pizzas (one of which was already made and sitting in the case) and 2 orders of pasta.  I have no idea what could have taken the kitchen so long.  It was about 45 minutes from the time we arrived until our food arrived.  

When the food finally did arrive, we discovered the piece of trash in my Greek salad and the food wasn't good.  My pasta carbonara was lumpy with cooked egg (though bacon in it was good).  The meatballs in my son's spaghetti and meatballs were dense and flavorless (though pasta did taste homemade).  My companion's pizza had undercooked dough, watery sauce, and little flavor.  His iced tea had sludgy stuff on the bottom -- I guess the equivalent of coffee dregs so was very unappetizing to look at or taste.  My younger son gobbled up his pre-made square of pizza, but by that point he was starving and probably would have eaten anything put in front of him without complaining.  

Atmosphere was also pretty lousy: very loud 70s rock music (such as Queen and Aerosmith).

The restaurant did not charge me for the trashy salad.  However, the bill still came to almost $80.00 including tip, so all in all, it was an expensive, slow, terrible meal.  We will never go back.
author: Katy O.

description: Stopped in here for lunch and had the BEST gnocchi! The staff was very helpful in picking our meals, great bread and fresh water served in bottles at the table. Great service, we never had to ask
author: Cherie P.

description: Best gnocchi I have ever had. This place is special. Outstanding food, great service, you will be hard pressed to find a better place to enjoy a meal. Five stars through and through.
author: Richard M.

description: Extremely nice staff! Food is AMAZING. Usually take photos of my food but it was so delicious that I forgot lol totally would recommend! I am a tourist from San Diego. Very chill place not dressy.
author: Mar R.

description: Everything about this place is wonderful. The food was perfect. Pasta was al dente, meatballs and sauce had great flavor and perfect amount of meat. The pizza was home made thin crust, and my family couldn't stop eating. The chef (maybe owner) came around a few times to check and see if everything was good. Great place, great food.
author: Matt D.

description: Here for a weekend vacation with family.  Found this spot and we all loved it!!!  Will absolutely be back!!!  Great service, great food!!!
author: Darrell B.

description: We went in on a Sunday night. We got there a bit early and the place wasn't too crowded but got crowded by 8pm. The place is pretty casual and decor isnt fancy - very bistro-ish. Food was decent - Spaghetti and Meatballs (al dente), Rigatoni Alla Grecia (mediocre) and the arugula salad (mediocre). Service was lacking as we had to remind our waiter of things a few times but hopefully will improve as the place matures. The pasta entrees took a long time to come out vs the pizza and lots of the other tables who ordered after us got their food before us. The owner Giuseppi was really warm and attentive to patrons. -Golly
author: G S.

description: The most amazing pizza place! They have the most amazing flavors and such a wonderful ambiance. Can't wait to come back!!:)
author: Paris S.

description: I wanted to LOVE this spot since they have creative slices and exceptional service. We came on a Saturday and had arugula salad and 2 slices. It was worth the value and the crust was super crisp but the flavor was lacking. Alcohol soon to come...
author: Maria C.

description: Simple, non-fussy good food.  On a recent trip to San Fran, stopped here for dinner, and we were not disappointed.  My husband had the fettucini alfredo; I'd say his was the best meal, but all of us were happy with what we got.  The Ceasar salad is quite good.  Kid friendly, very casual, and good service.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Randomly pick this based on Yelp reviews. It was awesome!  Between the pizza, lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs, all were amazing!  Staff was great. Food was awesome.
author: John B.

description: authentic and delicious. i would recommend the ravioli and the pizza. also their mozzarella is the most amazing i have ever tasted. the owner is really nice, but our other server was not great.
author: Button L.

description: Absolutely DELICIOUS!!! Perhaps the most "authentic" Italian grub you can get in SF. The pizza was perfect as was the ravioli. Could not have been more satisfied! And everyone who works here is delightful
author: Phylicia G.

description: Love this little place. Service was fabulous, food was hot. They've only been open about 4 months. I was greeted at the door and given recommendations for what to order. They have gluten free pasta and pizza. The penne was cooked perfectly and had an amazing pink cream sauce. The flavor was unbelievable. I want to eat here forever.
author: Sabrina A.

description: Neat place with friendly staff. Our group ordered lasagna (which was notable, with thin pasta surrounded by nice amounts of cheese and sauce and sausage), and several pizzas. Each of these was quite good, with an interesting and well balanced crust. Toppings were nice and the sauce was decent.
author: John P.

description:
My husband and I were visiting San Francisco and wanted to check out the North Beach area. Both of our meals were delicious. I had pasta with eggplant and tomato. The meal was made to perfection. We were served by a very nice waiter who was attentive and friendly.  I also ordered dessert-tiramisu.  It was perfect. I would definitely come back!

Simple, authentic Italian food in a great atmosphere, beautiful modern art work decorating the walls to enjoy too!
author: Karen M.

description: Really good pasta, tried the lasagne and the meatballs. Both excellent. Good al dente pasta. Good service. Decent lunch spot
author: James R.

description: I love this place. Family friendly, outstanding food, not too pricey, very friendly staff. All of their dishes are very good, some are spectacular (like the prosciutto pizza, and make sure to try the profiteroles. They may make you cry tears of joy.
author: Rob G.

description:
Very happy with the lasagna and penne arrabiata. Free bread was okay, and the paid focaccia bread was okay as well (but should be better considering it's extra).  Servers were very, very nice, but not particularly attentive.

Still the main courses will definitely bring us back.
author: Buddha B.

description: Just had a great dinner. The food and service was superb!  Both my daughter and I ordered a pizza. Both delicious and left overs will make a great breakfast.  The warm bread and olive oil among the best I've had. I don't understand why there weren't more dine in guests.  Don't let that stop you from enjoying the food and service!  It i worth a stop and so much better than the touristy places. I accidentally left my credit card when I signed my bill and was chased down the street to return it - Now that is service!
author: Diane D.

description: Amazing authentic Italian food and service!!! We had the gnocchi and calzone. Both were so fresh and tasty! They treated us with such kindness including the owner chatting with us for a while. He's the real deal!! We will go back often.
author: Joel C.

description: Best fettuccini Alfredo I've ever had! The service is excellent and the restaurant is really cute. A definite must if you love Italian food.
author: Tara V.

description: What a life saver on a chilly rainy day in San Francisco!!! They started us out with fresh bread. Excellent ideali pizza (great flavor) with great service and great atmosphere. Loved this lovely place. Wish this place was in Houston too.
author: Aliya V.

description: This place is ran by two Italian brothers. They are very friendly, genuine, and nice people. Fausto, who is one of the owners, has offered me a caffè macchiato while we were chatting about Italy. The coffee was exceptional; I have missed the invigorating and rich scent of a real Italian coffee. The lasagna and the pizza margherita that my friends and I have ordered were absolutely delicious. As an Italian born and raised, I know for fact how the authentic Italian dishes should taste like. I was also very satisfied with the service and had overall a tremendous experience. If you love Italians and if you like to talk and try some authentic Italian food, then this is the place for you. Buon Appetito!
author: Giulia B.

description:
Very nice and friendly stuff. If you look for an italian restaurant, its the right choice for you.
We had lasagne and tiramisu, which was very nice!
author: Samuel R.

description: Most amazing meal. All three dishes were superb!! We had artichoke ravioli, lasagna, and pizza. The pasta was fresh and homemade. Melts in your mouth. Dare I say the lasagna was better than grandma's and we were fortunate enough to bring home two pieces of pizza to enjoy later. The staff was super friendly and warm. Plenty of Italian spoken her by both staff and patrons. Absolute must in North Beach.
author: Leanne R.

description: Just leased my fourth car from this incredible dealership! They've always been honest and very accommodating. Shout out to Kevin Frankel and Jeff Cirks for being a dream team.
author: Alli G.

description: The pasta seasoning is too simple to my taste, and a bit on the salty side. I like their bread, though, quite flavorful.
author: Nick H.

description: This is the perfect place if you want to feel like you're in a local restaurant in Italy. The staff, cooks and music are all authentic Italian. The pizza is great with a perfect crust. We've ordered the penne arrabiata and the spaghetti and meatballs. Both were delicious, flavorful and cooked perfectly. The Caesar salad is so tasty. We will be returning again and again.
author: Ariel B.

description: So fresh and delicious I wonder if they have ever a garden out back. Loved every bite! I had the Capriciosa (prosciutto, egg, funghi, artichokes, olives)  only wish my stomach was larger so I could order another or toy the others on the menu. For authentic flavor, friendly people, pleasant atmosphere I would highly recommend Piccolo Forno. The by the slice selection looks amazing as well. Every detail was perfect! I will swing by here without a doubt next time I'm in little Italy
author: Alfonso T.

description: It's rare to say this, but the service was probably better than the food!  And that's not to say the food wasn't good. The minestrone soup was EXCELLENT, pizza pretty good and spaghetti great!
author: April S.

description: This is such a cute little place! It has GREAT pizza, pasta, and gelato! The gentlemen that helped us was amazing! He was so sweet and so friendly. He suggested all the best options! I love the Italian feeling you get the minute you walk in the door. And they speak fluent Italian which was pretty awesome to hear! Definitely a must go place when you're feeling like Italian cuisine! Such a friendly environment, with amazing food!
author: Tiana S.

description: My girlfriends and I were looking for great Italian and found the perfect spot. The gentleman was so friendly, the food was spectacular and the ambiance was gorgeous. The pizza and Alfredo are to die for. The art on the walls and the red chairs along with the Italian music playing make the building feel warm and welcoming. The gelato was fantastic. I highly suggest this place.
author: Jaymie E.

description:
Stopped by after watching Joy Koy at the Cobb and this place caught my girlfriends eye so we stopped in. We were welcomed so nicely by the owner and employees so we felt like we had to try their food. My gf had the eggplant pizza and I had the focaccia turkey sandwich. As far as my sandwich it was perfectly toasted with freshly sliced turkey. The turkey had great flavor and wasn't bland by any means and they had put some sort of house sauce that complimented the sandwich very well. Also came with an arugula salad dressed with oil and olives, which was a little bland for me but my gf liked it. The eggplant pizza was a very traditional Italian pizza, but to my gf's liking was slightly lackluster. It looked very fresh, however might need some tweaking since they just opened. We also had ordered a cannoli, but the owner wanted to treat us to a special dessert which turned out to be a dessert ravioli. This special dessert definitely won us over and was special. 

Our 4 star review is based on a combination of amazing service and hospitality with just minor changes needed to their eggplant pizza. We definitely stop by again when in the area. They made us feel like we were in Italy .
author: Pedro G.

description: Wanted to find an authentic Italian restaurant in North Beach while visiting and came across this place. There were two workers who were incredibly friendly. I was surprised with how quickly they attended to us and how quickly our food came. We started off with an appetizer of potatoes, which seemed to have rosemary, they were absolutely delicious. My husband and I split two diff. slices of pizza - one with zucchini and another with sausage and mushroom as well as the lasagna. It was seriously so good!! Cooked perfectly and great portion sizes.
