Honestly some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Definitely a casual place!
author: Danielle D.

description: This restaurant is fantastic ! We ordered the mozzarella prosciutto arugula appetizer was amazing ! It came with pine nuts and raisins and the flavors were delicious ! The olive oil was amazing ! My fiancé and I bought a bottle because it was that good ! Our pizza ( sausage and mushroom) was really good. The crust was perfect and crispy and the ingredients were fresh. We also ordered the tarfuto desert (Hazelnut , chocolate , vanilla ice cream. So good ! The servers were also very nice ! We will be back again !!! Very delicious !
author: Nancy T.

description: My beau and I knew this was the perfect place to start our romantic endeavor when we were warmly greeted at the door by the owner.  Bae and I indulged in delicious salads, a diavola pizza, wine and an excellent tartufo ciocc.  Highly recommended!  Enjoy your delicious moments!!
author: L W.

description: Very good. Great staff. Very authentic pizza by the slice with unique ingredients. This place is only going to get better.
author: Matt D.

description: Wonderful!  Italian feel, Italian spoken, and fresh ingredients. Italian food like no other! I will be back! Much competition, and many choices here in North Beach, but I highly recommend Piccolo Forno.
author: Chris S.

description:
Tunisian. Fresh, authentic, tasty. 

I got a large pizza slice, arugula with, as the server said, "lots of prosciutto."  It's not the hot, gooey pastry crust slice from Golden Boy, but it's not meant to be.  The pork, the soup, and the other meals looked fantastic.
author: The P.

description: The homemade pasta is amazing and the sauces are authentic and delicious!! Everyone that works there is incredibly friendly. We had homemade gnocchi with cheese sauce, eggplant parm with spaghetti, and a Greek salad. It was amazing!!! We will be back many times- it is our new favorite.
author: Scarlet F.

description: This place is amazing! The chef built the place himself and he cooks all the food. My son thought the pizza was fantastic and their white sauce is very very good. It's a plus to hear all the employees talk in Italian. I have nothing but good things to say about this place. You definitely should try it.
author: Sue H.

description: Amazing!!! The atmosphere was great, the service was phenomenal and the food... The food was delicious!! We had the ricotta gnocchi and it was really really tasty. Hope to eat there many times!
author: Jake O.

description: Traditional Italian food and pizza by the slice. The Eggplant Parmesan was delicious. Very friendly and warm service. Laid back atmosphere. This would be a nice place to grab a bite to eat and relax for a bit with a book.
author: Ania M.

description:
Try it instead of other north beach Italian restaurants - Flying under the radar never tasted so good.

I moved to the area recently and have been trying to find a reliable and affordable Italian place that I can frequent for comfort food without the fuss of dealing with tourism traffic. This place looks modern from the outside, but the place is very much run by real italians and they've not been jaded in terms of food quality from having to serve throngs of tourists (yet). 

The pizza is quite good (I've only tried the pepperoni once), but the truly outstanding dishes are the pastas that the cooks make on the spot. They're always properly al dente (just sightly undercooked like real Italians love) and the ingredients (such as the guanciale in their amatriciana) are some of the best I've tried along Columbus. I've tried 3 pastas here in 2 weeks since they've opened and they definitely make all the staples with more care and attention than other places. They also delightful appetizers that look great, but knowing me I'll probably just grab a slice with my pasta and pig out.

I cannot directly compare dishes to dishes along all the Italian restaurants I've eaten at in the community but I know quality when I smell/taste it and I'm definitely going to come back for much more in the future; especially if their pastas cost under 14, whereas some of the more established places try to rip you off for more than $25, which I find ridiculous.

Maybe they're just great for now cause they're new and they're trying hard to make an impression. I probably shouldn't write this review anyway cause I'd hate it if more traffic lowers their food standards..
author: Kevin K.

description: Delicious.  Can't wait until they get their wine license!  Exceptional meatballs.  Great homemade pasta.  And really amazing value especially by San Francisco standards.  Couldn't be more satisfied.
author: Andrew G.

description: Pizza and pasta are very good! Nice selection of salads. Lots of desserts to pick from. Overall, a very nice experience: clean, fresh and friendly!
author: Christopher L.

description: Great delicious neighborhood gem. Had the veal tortellini and my gf had the spaghetti meatballs. And we had the tiramisu and lemon sorbet for dessert. High quality home made flavor for the mains and dessert. A must try!
author: Nima R.

description: This place has great service. The owner and wait staff were very attentive and offered suggestions on the menu. I ordered a Greek salad to start. It had lots of creamy feta, but was overall disappointing. The dressing tasted bottled and bland, and tomatoes and romaine were the only vegetables. I had the daily special, the veal tortellini with meat sauce. It was good, a solid choice. I would come back, but not frequently as it seems a bit overpriced and the pasta did not "wow" me.
author: Colleen M.

description: Great little place with a relaxed atmosphere. Excellent food. When you go there ask for Simone, he will take care of you like family. Both him and Giuseppe have such good attitude and made us feel like old friends.
author: Blerina B.

description:
My must-go Italian every time I'm in SF.
Authentic food, large portions, genuine atmosphere and great service.
I've never eaten a Carbonara like this out of Rome.
author: Marco C.

description: Delicious!  They even accommodated my request for low a low carb meal.  Very friendly staff & owner.
The food was pretttyyyy good not fantastic, but the owner and waiter were awesome.  Went in for some pasta and pizza and would go back.
author: Paul H.

description: Very consistently delicious!  I absolutely love this place; it's full of neighborhood regulars and Italians visiting from out of town.
author: C B.

description: Fantastic! We stuck with the classics (lasagna and spaghetti with meatballs) and both were delicious. The insalata mista was fresh and generously sized. The owner and staff were very friendly and engaging. The icing on the cake was that prices were very reasonable by San Francisco standards. The space is small, but manages to be both airy and cozy. Yelp says this place is 'new and hot,' and I can see why. Highly recommended!
author: Travis C.

description: Very nice waitress. We had pizza. It was excellent with thin crust. We also had pasta special.  It was top notch. Also had lasagna.  Very good. It was also reasonably priced.
author: Eric S.

description: We had pasta, pizza and a salad here the other night. The food was delicious, the location was great and it was perfect with a couple of kids. Our waiter even brought us some free ice cream at the end for the kids even though they were being kind of loud and disruptive.
author: Mark A.

description: I got one of the personal pizzas, and it was divine. I left satisfied and full, but not too full. I haven't had a pizza that real in a while. Ditch Pizza Hut, the grease, and the heart burn, and get pizza that will actually make you glad you just ate pizza.
author: Alex M.

description: This is the best Italian food I've ever had. I came with my family that are visiting from  out of town and we were all loved this place. The prosciutto pizza was so fresh and tasty, the egg plant pasta was cooked just perfectly and everything was so flavorful and authentic. This place is also new so it's not too busy! I will definitely be coming back again soon!
author: Emily M.

description: The staff is amazing and the food is delicious! Come check this place out for sure. The atmosphere is so comfortable and relaxing. I feel like a regular already.
author: Sariah M.

description: you know,  it is hard to find a good spaghetti and meatballs. This place has a great spaghetti and meatballs. Definitely coming back.
author: Craig V.

description: Great authentic 12 inch pizza or pizza by the slice. Very nice atmosphere! Will definitely come back next time I'm in town!
author: Sarah H.

description: The food was mediocre at best; what was most intolerable was the waiter who brought dirty dishes to our table to inquire if we were finished- I guess trying to be efficient.  Waiter looked bored and couldn't care less.
author: Shaorn H.

description: Love it! This place is the real deal. I ordered three pizzas to go--Margherita, Salsiccia, and the Pizza Alla Diavola--and a few meatballs for the kids. The service and decor was great and welcoming. I even got a little extra treat while waiting for the order. It's a wonderful spot and we'll be back.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Excellent service & incredible homemade pasta. The Sauce was so good that I waned to lick the plate. Prices were very reasonable.
author: Jim Z.

description: I live in the neighborhood and have been wanting to try this place out. I stopped by today for lunch and couldn't be happier with the food and service.  I ordered the turkey sandwich and Greek salad, the two gentlemen working recommended the calzone over the turkey sandwich which was absolutely delicious. I'm excited that we now have a neighborhood restaurant that we can frequent. You can tell they are extremely passionate and authentic which comes through in all they do. Definitely worth checking out!
author: Monica T.

description: Perfecto! Amazing and fresh pasta, pizza, and cappuccino, and super friendly service.
author: Allie Rae T.

description: This place is cute and has delicious food. The service was excellent and the food was fresh and flavorful. You can tell they take pride in the food and service. Would recommend if looking for casual Italian food.
author: Kaitlyn D.

description: Amazing pizza! Their homemade tiramisu is to die for as well. So happy this is walking distance from my house.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Roman holiday in SF! They have pizza by the slice but I recommend ordering your own pie...amazing. We ordered the Ideale and it literally took me back to Rome. Also ordered the pork special which was tender and tasty. Great new spot!
author: Leah A.

description: We found this place as we walked back to the hotel from union square. Both pasta dishes and the pizza were perfect as was the service. We finished with affogato which was excellent.
author: Dean L.

description: Had the vegetarian pizza and LOVED it, so sad I forgot to take my leftovers. I have never had eggplant on a pizza but this very thinly sliced topping was excellent. So many other fresh veggies with just the right amount of sauce, not soggy but enough to really taste it. The crust was spot on as well, I easily are more than half of the 12" pizza on my own, not ashamed but definitely could've split it between 2 people and been more than satisfied.
author: Amanda W.

description: This is exactly what our neighborhood needed! Unpretentious, delicious pizza with little wait. It's reasonably priced, and the owner even gave me a free slice since it was the end of the day. If you want a nice warm dinner without any fuss, come here!
author: Natasha B.

description: We are visiting from SoCal and  looking for a little gem like this on our quest to find small non - touristy places with delicious food. My daughter spotted this place as we walked toward the more touristy part of north beach and we were glad she did. We tried the pizza margharita and the veggie pizza and a spinach pie like item that wasn't on the menu but was on display and they were delicious. Very friendly and attentive service. We will definitely return next time we're in SF.
author: Annette L.

description:
terrific italian pasta and desserts!!! 
highly recommend this place.
very friendly staff!!! Esp. Josepi
author: Henry O.

description: Great service, fresh ingredients and very clean.  Had lasagna and pizza and both were great. A great place for a casual dinner date! The only - no beer or wine
author: Ruth H.

description: A really enjoyable meal.  The atmosphere is upbeat and cozy.  The service was excellent and friendly.  The food was fresh, hot and seasoned perfectly.  It felt like you had been invited to an Italian family dinner..
author: Nan W.

description: Piccolo Forno has all the street appeal that a traveler like me was looking for in a local pizzeria. I am so happy to report that the pizza here is the best tasting pizza i have ever had, the price was fair and the atmosphere was cozy. I really think this will be a staple for my future visits to SF. I highly suggest this place but be warned it can get full fast!
author: Anthony A.
